Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-3 Transfer of prisoners to state prison.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
The sheriff of the county in which a criminal is sentenced to confinement in the state prison, or is sentenced to death, shall cause such convict to be removed from the county jail within five days after the sentence and conveyed to the state prison and delivered to the warden thereof.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-4 Jails -- Sheriff as keeper -- Use.
----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-4(1): The common jails in the several counties shall be kept by the sheriffs, and shall be used for:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-4(1)(a): the detention of persons committed to jail to secure their attendance as witnesses in criminal cases;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-4(1)(b): the detention of persons charged with crime and committed for trial;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-4(1)(c): the confinement of persons committed for contempt, or upon civil process, or by other authority of law; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-4(1)(d): the confinement of persons sentenced to imprisonment upon conviction of crime.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-4(2): If the county executive contracts with a private contractor to manage, maintain, operate, or construct county jail facilities, the sheriff shall perform whatever obligations are imposed upon him by that contract.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-5.5 Sheriff's classification of jail facilities -- Maximum operating capacity of jail facilities -- Transfer or release of prisoners -- Limitation -- Records regarding release.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-5.5(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-5.5(1)(a): Except as provided in Subsection (4), a county sheriff shall determine:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-5.5(1)(a)(i): subject to Subsection (1)(b), the classification of each jail facility or section of a jail facility under the sheriff's control;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-5.5(1)(a)(ii): the nature of each program conducted at a jail facility under the sheriff's control; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-5.5(1)(a)(iii): the internal operation of a jail facility under the sheriff's control.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-5.5(1)(b): A classification under Subsection (1)(a)(i) of a jail facility may not violate any applicable zoning ordinance or conditional use permit of the county or municipality.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-5.5(2): Except as provided in Subsection (4), each county sheriff shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-5.5(2)(a): with the approval of the county legislative body, establish a maximum operating capacity for each jail facility under the sheriff's control, based on facility design and staffing; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-5.5(2)(b): upon a jail facility reaching the jail facility's maximum operating capacity:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-5.5(2)(b)(i): transfer prisoners to another appropriate facility:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-5.5(2)(b)(i)(A): under the sheriff's control; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-5.5(2)(b)(i)(B): available to the sheriff by contract;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-5.5(2)(b)(ii): release prisoners:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-5.5(2)(b)(ii)(A): to a supervised release program, according to release criteria established by the sheriff; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-5.5(2)(b)(ii)(B): to another alternative incarceration program developed by the sheriff; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-5.5(2)(b)(iii): admit prisoners in accordance with law and a uniform admissions policy imposed equally upon all entities using the county jail.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-5.5(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-5.5(3)(a): The sheriff shall keep records of the release status and the type of release program or alternative incarceration program for any prisoner released under Subsection (2)(b)(ii).
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-5.5(3)(b): The sheriff shall make these records available upon request to the Department of Corrections, the Judiciary, and the Commission on Criminal and Juvenile Justice.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-5.5(4): This section may not be construed to authorize a sheriff to modify provisions of a contract with the Department of Corrections to house in a county jail an individual sentenced to the Department of Corrections.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-5.6 Probation supervision -- Violation of probation -- Detention -- Hearing.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-5.6(1): 77-36-1.1; 76-6-106; 76-3-203.5 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-5.6(1)(a): "Probationer" means an individual on probation under the supervision of the county sheriff.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-5.6(1)(b): 77-36-1.1; 76-6-106
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-5.6(1)(b)(i): 77-36-1.1 "Qualifying domestic violence offense" means the same as that term is defined in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-5.6(1)(b)(ii): 76-6-106 "Qualifying domestic violence offense" does not include criminal mischief as described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-5.6(1)(c): 76-3-203.5 "Violent felony" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-5.6(2): A county sheriff shall ensure that the court is notified of violations of the terms and conditions of a probationer's probation when the county sheriff determines that:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-5.6(2)(a): incarceration is recommended as a sanction;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-5.6(2)(b): a graduated and evidence-based response is not an appropriate response to the offender's violation and recommends revocation of probation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-5.6(2)(c): there is probable cause that the conduct that led to a violation of probation is:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-5.6(2)(c)(i): a violent felony; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-5.6(2)(c)(ii): a qualifying domestic violence offense.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-5.6(3): A county sheriff may take custody of, and detain, a probationer for a maximum of 72 hours, excluding weekends and holidays, if there is probable cause to believe that the probationer has committed a violation of probation.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-5.6(4): A county sheriff may not detain a probationer or parolee for longer than 72 hours without obtaining a warrant issued by the court.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-5.6(5): If the county sheriff detains a probationer under Subsection (3), the county sheriff shall ensure the proper court is notified.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-5.6(6): A written order from the county sheriff is sufficient authorization for a peace officer to incarcerate a probationer if the county sheriff has determined that there is probable cause to believe that the probationer has violated the conditions of probation.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-5.6(7): If a probationer commits a violation outside of the jurisdiction of the county sheriff supervising the probationer, the arresting law enforcement agency is not required to hold or transport the probationer to the county sheriff.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-5.6(8): This section does not require the county sheriff to release a probationer who is being held for something other than a probation violation, including a warrant issued for new criminal conduct or a new conviction where the individual is sentenced to incarceration.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-6 Service of process on prisoners -- Penalty.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-6(1): A sheriff or jailer upon whom a paper in a judicial proceeding directed to a prisoner in the sheriff's or jailer's custody is served shall forthwith deliver the paper to the prisoner, with a note thereon of the time of its service.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-6(2): (1) A sheriff or jailer who neglects to comply with Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-7 Special guards for jail.
------------------------------------------------------
The sheriff when necessary may with the assent of the county executive employ a temporary guard for the protection of the county jail, or for the safekeeping of prisoners, and the expenses thereof shall be a county charge.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-8 Care of prisoners -- Funding of services -- Private contractor.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-8(1): As used in this section, "medication assisted treatment plan" means a prescription plan to use buprenorphine, methadone, or naltrexone to treat substance use withdrawal symptoms or an opioid use disorder.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-8(2): (7); (2)(d)(i); (ii) Except as provided in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-8(2)(c)(iii): the potential for harm to the person by reason of delay or the denial of medical care would be substantial;

-------------------------------------------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-9 Federal prisoners.
------------------------------------------------
Persons convicted of crime in any of the courts of the United States in the state of Utah as well as prisoners held to answer before such courts for a violation of any of the laws of the United States shall be received and held in the jail of any county under the same regulations and laws governing prisoners held under the authority of this state, and upon such terms as to compensation as may be agreed upon by the county and the United States.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-9.5 Citizenship determination of incarcerated persons.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-9.5(1): 41-6a-502 The sheriff shall make a reasonable effort to determine the citizenship status of a person charged with a felony or driving under the influence under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-9.5(2): If the confined person is a foreign national, the sheriff shall make a reasonable effort to verify that the person:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-9.5(2)(a): has been lawfully admitted into the United States; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-9.5(2)(b): the person's lawful status has not expired.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-9.5(3): (2); (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-9.5(3)(a): If the sheriff cannot verify the confined person's lawful status from documents in the person's possession, the sheriff shall attempt to verify that status within 48 hours of the person's confinement at the jail through contacting:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-9.5(3)(a)(i): the Law Enforcement Support Center of the United States Department of Homeland Security; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-9.5(3)(a)(ii): an office or agency designated for citizenship status verification by the United States Department of Homeland Security.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-9.5(3)(b): (2); (3)(a) The sheriff shall notify the United States Department of Homeland Security of a person whose lawful citizenship status cannot be verified under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-9.5(4): It is a rebuttable presumption for the purpose of determining the grant or issuance of a bond that a person who is verified under this section as a foreign national not lawfully admitted into the United States is at risk of flight.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-10 Prisoners under civil process.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Whenever a person is committed upon process in a civil action or proceeding, except when the state is a party thereto, the sheriff is not bound to receive such person unless security is given on the part of the party at whose instance the process is issued, by deposit of money, to meet the expenses of necessary food, clothing and bedding for the committed person, or to detain such person any longer than the expenses are provided for. This section does not apply to cases where a party is committed as a punishment for disobedience to the mandates, process, writs or orders of court.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-11 Return of process.
-------------------------------------------------
When process or notice is returnable, the sheriff may enclose such process or notice in an envelope addressed to the officer or person from whom the same emanated, and deposit it in the post office, prepaying the postage.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-12 Return of process as prima facie evidence.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
The return of the sheriff upon process or notice is prima facie evidence of the facts in such return stated.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-13 Failure or delay in making return on process -- Penalty.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
If a sheriff does not return without delay a process or notice in the sheriff's possession with the necessary endorsement thereon, the sheriff is liable to the party aggrieved for all damages sustained by the aggrieved party.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-14 Failure to levy execution -- Penalty.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
If the sheriff to whom a writ of execution is delivered neglects or refuses, after being required by the creditor or the creditor's attorney, the fees having first been paid or tendered, to levy upon or sell any property of the party charged in the writ which is liable to be levied upon and sold, the sheriff shall be liable to the creditor for the value of such property.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-15 Neglect or refusal to pay over money -- Penalty.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
If the sheriff neglects or refuses to pay over on demand to the person entitled thereto any money which may come into the sheriff's hands by virtue of the sheriff's office, after deducting all legal fees, the amount thereof with 25% damages and interest at the rate of 1% per month from the time of demand may be recovered by such person; provided, that such sheriff may pay such money into the court or to the clerk thereof issuing the writ or process upon which such money is collected or received and from the time of such payment the sheriff shall be relieved of all liability therefor, unless the detention is shown to have been wrongful.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-16 Declaring office vacant.
-------------------------------------------------------
When the sheriff is committed for not paying over money received by the sheriff by virtue of the sheriff's office and remains committed for 60 days the sheriff's office is vacant.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-17 Escapes -- Sheriff's liability.
--------------------------------------------------------------
A sheriff who suffers the escape of a person arrested in a civil action, without the consent or connivance of the party in whose behalf the arrest or imprisonment is made, is liable as follows:Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-17(1): When the arrest is upon an order to hold to bail or upon a surrender in exoneration of bail before judgment the sheriff is liable to the plaintiff as bail.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-17(2): When the arrest is on an execution or commitment to enforce the payment of money the sheriff is liable for the amount expressed in the execution or commitment.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-17(3): When the arrest is on an execution or commitment other than to enforce the payment of money the sheriff is liable for the actual damages sustained.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-17(4): Upon being sued for damages for an escape or rescue the sheriff may introduce evidence in mitigation and exculpation.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-18 Rescues -- Sheriff's liability.
--------------------------------------------------------------
The sheriff is liable for the rescue of a person arrested in a civil action equally as for an escape.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-19 Action for escape or rescue -- Defenses.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
An action cannot be maintained against the sheriff for a rescue or for an escape of a person arrested upon an execution or commitment, if after that person's rescue or escape and before the commencement of the action the prisoner returns to the jail or is retaken by the sheriff or by any other person.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-20 Only written directions to sheriff binding.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
No direction or authority by a party or the party's attorney to the sheriff in respect to the execution of process or the return thereof or to any act or omission relating thereto is available to discharge or excuse the sheriff from liability for neglect or misconduct, unless it is contained in a writing, signed by the attorney of the party or by the party, if the party has no attorney.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-21 Process justifies sheriff's action.
------------------------------------------------------------------
A sheriff is justified in the execution of, and shall execute, all process, writs and orders regular on their face and issued by competent authority.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-22 Process to be exhibited.
-------------------------------------------------------
The officer executing process shall then, and at all times subsequent as long as the officer retains it, upon request show the same, with all papers attached, to any interested person.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-23 Crier of court.
----------------------------------------------
The sheriff in attendance upon court shall, if required by the court, act as crier for the court, call the parties and witnesses and other persons bound to appear at the court, and make proclamation of the opening and adjournment of court and of any other matter under its direction.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-24 Service of papers, other than process, on sheriff -- Powers of successor.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Service upon the sheriff of a paper other than process may be made by delivering it or a copy thereof to the sheriff or to one of the sheriff's deputies or to a person in charge of the sheriff's office during office hours, or, if no such person is there, by leaving it in a conspicuous place in the office. When any process remains with the sheriff unexecuted, in whole or in part, at the time of the sheriff's death, resignation of office or at the expiration of the sheriff's office such process shall be executed by the sheriff's successor in office; and when the sheriff sells real estate under and by virtue of an execution or order of court the sheriff or the sheriff's successor in office shall execute and deliver to the purchaser all such deeds and conveyances as are required by law and necessary for that purpose, and such deeds and conveyances shall be as valid in law as if they had been executed by the sheriff who made the sale.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-25 Service of process on sheriff -- When constable to act.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
In cases where it appears in any court of record that the sheriff is a party, or where an affidavit is filed with the clerk of the court stating partiality, prejudice, consanguinity or interest on the part of the sheriff, the clerk of the court shall direct process to any constable of the county, whose duty it shall be to execute it in the same manner as if the constable were sheriff.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-26 Sheriff -- Process on behalf of state -- Fees.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-26(1): The sheriff shall without fee serve and return all process in criminal cases to which the state is a party, that are lawfully issued by any court of the state, except as otherwise provided by law.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-26(2): If the process issues from a court outside of his county, he is entitled to his actual expenses necessarily incurred.  The expenses shall be paid by the county where the process was issued.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-27 Sheriff -- Assignment of court bailiffs -- Contract and costs.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-27(1): 53-13-103; 53-13-105 The sheriff shall assign law enforcement officers or special function officers, as defined under Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-27(2):

The contract may not exceed amounts appropriated by the Legislature for that purpose.  The county shall assume costs related to security administration, supervision, travel, equipment, and training of bailiffs.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-27(2)(b): The contract shall specify the agreed services, costs of services, and terms of payment.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-27(2)(c): If the court is located in the same facility as a state or local law enforcement agency and the county sheriff's office is not in close proximity to the court, the state court administrator in consultation with the sheriff may enter into a  contract with the state or local law enforcement agency for bailiff and security services subject to meeting all other requirements of this section.  If the services are provided by another agency, the county sheriff shall have no responsibility for the services under this section.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-28 Maintaining order -- Imposing restitution.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-28(1): If a prisoner commits an act of violence against another person, attempts to damage jail property, attempts to escape, or refuses to obey a lawful order and reasonable command, an officer or other employee of the jail may use all reasonable means under the circumstances, including the use of a weapon, to defend himself, defend another, protect jail property, prevent escape, or enforce compliance with a lawful order and reasonable command.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-28(2): A jail may request restitution from a prisoner for damaging jail property as part of an administrative disciplinary hearing.  To enforce restitution, a jail may withdraw money from or place a hold on a prisoner's account.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-29 Notice to county jail facilities.
----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-29(1): Before an order is entered granting visitation or correspondence between a person and a prisoner, the moving party shall provide notice to the facility administrator.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-29(2): The court shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-29(2)(a): provide an opportunity to the facility representative to respond before the order is granted; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-29(2)(b): consider facility policy.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-31 Sheriff -- Primary law enforcement authority.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
The sheriff is the primary law enforcement authority of state law on federal land except as otherwise assigned by law to the authority of a state or municipal law enforcement agency.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32 County jail reporting requirements.
------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(1): 63M-7-201; 58-37-2 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(1)(a): 63M-7-201 "Commission" means the State Commission on Criminal and Juvenile Justice created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(1)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(1)(b)(i): "In-custody death" means an inmate death that occurs while the inmate is in the custody of a county jail.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(1)(b)(ii): "In-custody death" includes an inmate death that occurs while the inmate is:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(1)(b)(ii)(A): being transported for medical care; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(1)(b)(ii)(B): receiving medical care outside of a county jail.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(1)(c): "Inmate" means an individual who is processed or booked into custody or housed in a county jail in the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(1)(d): 58-37-2 "Opiate" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(2): Each county jail shall submit a report to the commission before June 15 of each year that includes, for the preceding calendar year:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(2)(a): the average daily inmate population each month;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(2)(b): the number of inmates in the county jail on the last day of each month who identify as each race or ethnicity included in the Standards for Transmitting Race and Ethnicity published by the Untied States Federal Bureau of Investigation;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(2)(c): the number of inmates booked into the county jail;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(2)(d): the number of inmates held in the county jail each month on behalf of each of the following entities:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(2)(d)(i): the Bureau of Indian Affairs;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(2)(d)(ii): a state prison;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(2)(d)(iii): a federal prison;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(2)(d)(iv): the United States Immigration and Customs Enforcement;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(2)(d)(v): any other entity with which a county jail has entered a contract to house inmates on the entity's behalf;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(2)(e): the number of inmates that are denied pretrial release and held in the custody of the county jail while the inmate awaited final disposition of the inmate's criminal charges;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(2)(f): for each inmate booked into the county jail:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(2)(f)(i): the name of the agency that arrested the inmate;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(2)(f)(ii): the date and time the inmate was booked into and released from the custody of the county jail;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(2)(f)(iii): if the inmate was released from the custody of the county jail, the reason the inmate was released from the custody of the county jail;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(2)(f)(iv): if the inmate was released from the custody of the county jail on a financial condition, whether the financial condition was set by a county sheriff or a court;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(2)(f)(v): the number of days the inmate was held in the custody of the county jail before disposition of the inmate's criminal charges;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(2)(f)(vi): whether the inmate was released from the custody of the county jail before final disposition of the inmate's criminal charges; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(2)(f)(vii): the state identification number of the inmate;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(2)(g): the number of in-custody deaths that occurred at the county jail;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(2)(h): for each in-custody death:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(2)(h)(i): the name, gender, race, ethnicity, age, and known or suspected medical diagnosis or disability, if any, of the deceased;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(2)(h)(ii): the date, time, and location of death;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(2)(h)(iii): the law enforcement agency that detained, arrested, or was in the process of arresting the deceased; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(2)(h)(iv): a brief description of the circumstances surrounding the death;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(2)(i): the known, or discoverable on reasonable inquiry, causes and contributing factors of each of the in-custody deaths described in Subsection (2)(g);
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(2)(j): the county jail's policy for notifying an inmate's next of kin after the inmate's in-custody death;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(2)(k): the county jail policies, procedures, and protocols:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(2)(k)(i): for treatment of an inmate experiencing withdrawal from alcohol or substance use, including use of opiates;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(2)(k)(ii): that relate to the county jail's provision, or lack of provision, of medications used to treat, mitigate, or address an inmate's symptoms of withdrawal, including methadone and all forms of buprenorphine and naltrexone; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(2)(k)(iii): that relate to screening, assessment, and treatment of an inmate for a substance use or mental health disorder; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(2)(l): any report the county jail provides or is required to provide under federal law or regulation relating to inmate deaths.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(3)(a): Subsection (2) does not apply to a county jail if the county jail:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(3)(a)(i): collects and stores the data described in Subsection (2); and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(3)(a)(ii): enters into a memorandum of understanding with the commission that allows the commission to access the data described in Subsection (2).
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(3)(b): The memorandum of understanding described in Subsection (3)(a)(ii) shall include a provision to protect any information related to an ongoing investigation and comply with all applicable federal and state laws.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(3)(c): If the commission accesses data from a county jail in accordance with Subsection (3)(a), the commission may not release a report prepared from that data, unless:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(3)(c)(i): the commission provides the report for review to:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(3)(c)(i)(A): the county jail; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(3)(c)(i)(B): any arresting agency that is named in the report; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(3)(c)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(3)(c)(ii)(A): the county jail approves the report for release;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(3)(c)(ii)(B): the county jail reviews the report and prepares a response to the report to be published with the report; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(3)(c)(ii)(C): the county jail fails to provide a response to the report within four weeks after the day on which the commission provides the report to the county jail.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(4): The commission shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(4)(a): compile the information from the reports described in Subsection (2);
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(4)(b): omit or redact any identifying information of an inmate in the compilation to the extent omission or redaction is necessary to comply with state and federal law;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(4)(c): submit the compilation to the Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Interim Committee and the Utah Substance Use and Mental Health Advisory Committee before November 1 of each year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(4)(d): submit the compilation to the protection and advocacy agency designated by the governor before November 1 of each year.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(5): The commission may not provide access to or use a county jail's policies, procedures, or protocols submitted under this section in a manner or for a purpose not described in this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-32(6): A report including only the names and causes of death of deceased inmates and the facility in which they were being held in custody shall be made available to the public.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-33 Commissary account disclosure requirements.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-33(1): 77-16b-102 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-33(1)(a): "Commissary account" means an account from which an inmate may withdraw money, deposited by the inmate or another individual, to purchase discretionary items for sale by a correctional facility.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-33(1)(b): "Commissary purchase" means a transaction initiated by an inmate by which the inmate obtains an item or items offered for sale by the correctional facility in exchange for money withdrawn from the inmate's commissary account.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-33(1)(c): 77-16b-102 "Correctional facility" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-33(1)(d): "Inmate" means an individual in the custody of a correctional facility for criminal charges or a criminal conviction.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-33(2): A correctional facility that employs a policy or practice by which the correctional facility withdraws money from an inmate's commissary account, for any purpose other than a commissary purchase, must disclose that policy or practice to the inmate or any other individual seeking to make a deposit of money into the inmate's commissary account before the correctional facility may accept and deposit the money into the inmate's commissary account.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-34(1): As used in this section:

Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-34(1)(d): "Suicide barrier" means a barrier installed on an upper level of a building to prevent an individual from falling.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-34(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-34(2)(a): There is created within the department the Suicide Deterrence Grant Program.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-34(2)(b): The purpose of the program is to award grants to county jails for materials to construct and install suicide barriers.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-34(3)(a)(vi): other information the department determines necessary to evaluate the proposal.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-34(3)(b): (2) When evaluating a proposal for a grant, the department shall consider:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-34(3)(b)(i): (2) the likelihood the proposal will accomplish the purpose described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-34(3)(b)(ii): the cost of the proposal;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-34(3)(b)(iii): the extent to which additional funding sources or existing or planned partnerships may benefit the proposal; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-22-34(3)(b)(iv): the viability and sustainability of the proposal.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-3 Seal.
-----------------------------------
The county surveyor shall have a seal, to be furnished by the county, the impression of which shall contain the following words: "State of Utah, County Surveyor," together with the name of the county in which the same is to be used.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-7 Survey by direction of court -- Compensation.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
When land, the title to which is in dispute before any court, is divided by a county line, the court making an order of survey may direct the order to the surveyor of any county in which any part of the land is situated. The court order shall also provide for reasonable compensation for said services.

-------------------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-12(2): take evidence from any person who may have information to prove any point material to a survey or whenever necessary in the discharge of his official duties; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-12(3): Title 46, Chapter 4, Uniform Electronic Transactions Act establish procedures and guidelines to govern the electronic submission of plats, records, and other documents to the county surveyor's office consistent with


Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-13 Setting monuments.
-------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-13(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-13(1)(a): When establishing a section, quarter-section, or center corners, the county surveyor or his designee shall set a monument of durable quality.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-13(1)(b): Wherever the nature of the ground will not allow the setting of a monument at the exact corner as described, then a witness monument shall be set.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-13(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-13(2)(a): Whenever possible, section corners and quarter-section corners shall be witnessed by at least four references of durable quality.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-13(2)(b): All references shall be carefully described, and their bearings and distances noted in the report.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-16 Resurveys.
-----------------------------------------
In the resurvey of lands surveyed under the authority of the United States, the county surveyor or the county surveyor's designee shall observe the following rules:Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-16(1): Section and quarter-section corners, and all other corners established by the government survey, shall stand as the true corner.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-16(2): Missing corners shall be reestablished at the point where existing evidence would indicate the original corner was located by the government survey.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-16(3): In all cases, missing corners shall be reestablished with reference to the United States Manual of Surveying Instructions.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17 Map of boundary survey -- Procedure for filing -- Contents -- Marking of monuments -- Record of corner changes -- Penalties.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17(1): As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17(1)(a): "Land surveyor" means a surveyor who is licensed to practice land surveying in this state in accordance with Title 58, Chapter 22, Professional Engineers and Professional Land Surveyors Licensing Act.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17(1)(b): "Township" means a term used in the context of identifying a geographic area in common surveyor practice.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17(2)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17(2)(a)(i): Each land surveyor making a boundary survey of lands within this state to establish or reestablish a boundary line or to obtain data for constructing a map or plat showing a boundary line shall file a map of the survey that meets the requirements of this section with the county surveyor or designated office within 90 days of the establishment or reestablishment of a boundary.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17(2)(a)(ii): A land surveyor who fails to file a map of the survey as required by Subsection (2)(a)(i) is guilty of an infraction.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17(2)(a)(iii): Each failure to file a map of the survey as required by Subsection (2)(a)(i) is a separate violation.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17(2)(b): The county surveyor or designated office shall file and index the map of the survey.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17(2)(c): The map shall be a public record in the office of the county surveyor or designated office.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17(3): This type of map shall show:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17(3)(a): the location of survey by quarter section and township and range;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17(3)(b): the date of survey;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17(3)(c): the scale of drawing and north point;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17(3)(d): the distance and course of all lines traced or established, giving the basis of bearing and the distance and course to two or more section corners or quarter corners, including township and range, or to identified monuments within a recorded subdivision;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17(3)(e): all measured bearings, angles, and distances separately indicated from those of record;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17(3)(f): a written boundary description of property surveyed;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17(3)(g): all monuments set and their relation to older monuments found;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17(3)(h): a detailed description of monuments found and monuments set, indicated separately;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17(3)(i): the surveyor's seal or stamp; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17(3)(j): the surveyor's business name and address.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17(4)(a): The map shall contain a written narrative that explains and identifies:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17(4)(a)(i): the purpose of the survey;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17(4)(a)(ii): the basis on which the lines were established; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17(4)(a)(iii): the found monuments and deed elements that controlled the established or reestablished lines.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17(4)(b): If the narrative is a separate document, it shall contain:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17(4)(b)(i): the location of the survey by quarter section and by township and range;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17(4)(b)(ii): the date of the survey;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17(4)(b)(iii): the surveyor's stamp or seal; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17(4)(b)(iv): the surveyor's business name and address.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17(4)(c): The map and narrative shall be referenced to each other if they are separate documents.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17(5): The map and narrative shall be created on material of a permanent nature on stable base reproducible material in the sizes required by the county surveyor.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17(6): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17(6)(a): Any monument set by a licensed professional land surveyor to mark or reference a point on a property or land line shall be durably and visibly marked or tagged with the registered business name or the letters "L.S." followed by the registration number of the surveyor in charge.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17(6)(b): If the monument is set by a licensed land surveyor who is a public officer, it shall be marked with the official title of the office.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17(7): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17(7)(a): If, in the performance of a survey, a surveyor finds or makes any changes to the section corner or quarter-section corner, or their accessories, the surveyor shall complete and submit to the county surveyor or designated office a record of the changes made.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17(7)(b): The record shall be submitted within 45 days of the corner visits and shall include the surveyor's seal, business name, and address.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17(8): The Utah State Board of Engineers and Land Surveyors Examiners may revoke the license of any land surveyor who fails to comply with the requirements of this section, according to the procedures set forth in Title 58, Chapter 1, Division of Professional Licensing Act.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17(9): Each federal or state agency, board, or commission, special district, special service district, or municipal corporation that makes a boundary survey of lands within this state shall comply with this section.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17.5 Corner perpetuation and filing -- Definitions -- Establishment of corner file -- Preservation of map records -- Filing fees -- Exemptions.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17.5(1): As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17.5(1)(a): "Accessory to a corner" means any exclusively identifiable physical object whose spatial relationship to the corner is recorded.  Accessories may be bearing trees, bearing objects, monuments, reference monuments, line trees, pits, mounds, charcoal-filled bottles, steel or wooden stakes, or other objects.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17.5(1)(b): "Corner," unless otherwise qualified, means a property corner, a property controlling corner, a public land survey corner, or any combination of these.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17.5(1)(c): "Geographic coordinates" means mathematical values that designate a position on the earth relative to a given reference system.  Coordinates shall be established pursuant to Title 57, Chapter 10, Utah Coordinate System.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17.5(1)(d): "Land surveyor" means a surveyor who is licensed to practice land surveying in this state in accordance with Title 58, Chapter 22, Professional Engineers and Professional Land Surveyors Licensing Act.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17.5(1)(e): "Monument" means an accessory that is presumed to occupy the exact position of a corner.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17.5(1)(f): "Property controlling corner" means a public land survey corner or any property corner which does not lie on a property line of the property in question, but which controls the location of one or more of the property corners of the property in question.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17.5(1)(g): "Property corner" means a geographic point of known geographic coordinates on the surface of the earth, and is on, a part of, and controls a property line.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17.5(1)(h): "Public land survey corner" means any corner actually established and monumented in an original survey or resurvey used as a basis of legal descriptions for issuing a patent for the land to a private person from the United States government.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17.5(1)(i): "Reference monument" means a special monument that does not occupy the same geographical position as the corner itself, but whose spatial relationship to the corner is recorded and which serves to witness the corner.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17.5(1)(j): "Township" means a term used in the context of identifying a geographic area in common surveyor practice.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17.5(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17.5(2)(a): Any land surveyor making a boundary survey of lands within this state and utilizing a corner shall, within 90 days, complete, sign, and file with the county surveyor of the county where the corner is situated, a written record to be known as a corner file for every public land survey corner and accessory to the corner which is used as control in any survey by the surveyor, unless the corner and its accessories are already a matter of record in the county.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17.5(2)(b): Where reasonably possible, the corner file shall include the geographic coordinates of the corner.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17.5(2)(c): A surveyor may file a corner record as to any property corner, reference monument, or accessory to a corner.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17.5(2)(d): Corner records may be filed concerning corners used before the effective date of this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17.5(3): The county surveyor of the county containing the corners shall have on record as part of the official files maps of each township within the county, the bearings and lengths of the connecting lines to government corners, and government corners looked for and not found.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17.5(4): The county surveyor shall make these records available for public inspection at the county facilities during normal business hours.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17.5(5): Filing fees for corner records shall be established by the county legislative body consistent with existing fees for similar services.  All corners, monuments, and their accessories used prior to the effective date of this section shall be accepted and filed with the county surveyor without requiring the payment of the fees.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17.5(6): 17-23-14 When a corner record of a public land survey corner is required to be filed under the provisions of this section and the monument needs to be reconstructed or rehabilitated, the land surveyor shall contact the county surveyor in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17.5(7): A corner record may not be filed unless it is signed by a land surveyor.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-17.5(8): All filings relative to official cadastral surveys of the Bureau of Land Management of the United States of America performed by authorized personnel shall be exempt from filing fees.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-18 Amendment of survey maps or narratives by affidavit of corrections.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-18(1): Any survey map or narrative filed under the provisions of this chapter may be amended by an affidavit of corrections:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-18(1)(a): to show any courses or distances omitted from the map or narrative;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-18(1)(b): to correct an error in the description of the real property shown on the map or narrative; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-18(1)(c): to correct any other errors or omissions where the error or omission is ascertainable from the data shown on the map or narrative as recorded.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-18(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-18(2)(a): The affidavit of correction shall be prepared by the licensed professional land surveyor who filed the map or narrative.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-18(2)(b): In the event of the death, disability, or retirement from practice of the surveyor who filed the map or narrative, the county surveyor may prepare the affidavit of correction.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-18(2)(c): The affidavit shall set forth in detail the corrections made.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-18(2)(d): The seal and signature of the licensed professional land surveyor filing the affidavit of correction shall be affixed to the affidavit.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-18(3): The county surveyor having jurisdiction of the map or narrative shall certify that the affidavit of correction has been examined and that the changes shown on the map or narrative are changes permitted under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-18(4): Nothing in this section permits changes in courses or distances for the purpose of redesigning parcel configurations.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-19 County permitted to establish Public Land Corner Preservation Fund -- Use of fund -- Fee schedule for filing maps.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-19(1): Title 17, Chapter 23, County Surveyor; Title 57, Chapter 10, Utah Coordinate System The county legislative body may establish by ordinance a fund to be known as the Public Land Corner Preservation Fund.  Money generated for the fund shall be used only to pay expenses incurred and authorized by the county surveyor in the establishment, reestablishment, and maintenance of corners of government surveys pursuant to the powers and duties provided under
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-19(2): 17-23-17 The county legislative body may by ordinance establish a fee schedule for filing maps in the county surveyor's office of surveys filed under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-20 Final plats of local entity boundary actions -- County surveyor approval of final plat -- Plat requirements.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-20(1): 67-1a-6.5; 17-50-105; (4); 67-1a-6.5 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-20(1)(a): 67-1a-6.5 "Approving authority" means the person or body required under applicable statute to submit to the lieutenant governor a notice of an impending boundary action, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-20(1)(b): 17-50-105
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-20(1)(b)(i): "Boundary action" means any action that establishes, modifies, or eliminates the boundary of a local entity, including incorporation or creation, annexation, withdrawal or disconnection, consolidation, division, boundary adjustment, and dissolution.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-20(1)(b)(ii): 17-50-105 "Boundary action" does not include the determination of the true location of a county boundary under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-20(1)(c): (4) "Final local entity plat" means a plat that meets the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-20(1)(d): 67-1a-6.5 "Local entity" has the same meaning as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-20(2): Upon request and in consultation with the county recorder, the county surveyor of each county in which property depicted on a plat is located shall determine whether the plat is a final local entity plat.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-20(3): (4)
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-20(3)(a): (4) If a county surveyor determines that a plat meets the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-20(3)(b): The county surveyor shall indicate the approval of a plat as a final local entity plat on the face of the final local entity plat.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-20(4): Title 58, Chapter 22, Professional Engineers and Professional Land Surveyors Licensing Act A plat may not be approved as a final local entity plat unless the plat:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-20(4)(a): contains a graphical illustration depicting:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-20(4)(a)(i): in the case of a proposed creation or incorporation of a local entity, the boundary of the proposed local entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-20(4)(a)(ii): in the case of a proposed annexation of an area into an existing local entity, the boundary of the area proposed to be annexed;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-20(4)(a)(iii): in the case of a proposed adjustment of a boundary between local entities, the boundary of the area that the boundary adjustment proposes to move from inside the boundary of one local entity to inside the boundary of another local entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-20(4)(a)(iv): in the case of a proposed withdrawal or disconnection of an area from a local entity, the boundary of the area that is proposed to be withdrawn or disconnected;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-20(4)(a)(v): in the case of a proposed consolidation of multiple local entities, the boundary of the proposed consolidated local entity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-20(4)(a)(vi): in the case of a proposed division of a local entity into multiple local entities, the boundary of each new local entity created by the proposed division;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-20(4)(b): is created on reproducible material that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-20(4)(b)(i): permanent in nature; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-20(4)(b)(ii): the size and type specified by the county recorder;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-20(4)(c): is drawn to a scale so that all data are legible;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-20(4)(d): contains complete and accurate boundary information, including, as appropriate, calls along existing boundary lines, sufficient to enable:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-20(4)(d)(i): the county surveyor to establish the boundary on the ground, in the event of a dispute about the accurate location of the boundary; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-20(4)(d)(ii): the county recorder to identify, for tax purposes, each tract or parcel included within the boundary;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-20(4)(e): depicts a name for the plat, approved by the county recorder, that is sufficiently unique to distinguish the plat from all other recorded plats in the county;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-20(4)(f): contains:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-20(4)(f)(i): the name of the local entity whose boundary is depicted on the plat;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-20(4)(f)(ii): the name of each county within which any property depicted on the plat is located;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-20(4)(f)(iii): the date that the plat was prepared;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-20(4)(f)(iv): a north arrow and legend;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-20(4)(f)(v): a signature block for:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-20(4)(f)(v)(A): the signatures of:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-20(4)(f)(v)(A)(I): the professional land surveyor who prepared the plat; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-20(4)(f)(v)(A)(II): the local entity's approving authority; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-20(4)(f)(v)(B): the approval of the county surveyor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-20(4)(f)(vi): a three-inch by three-inch block in the lower right hand corner for the county recorder's use when recording the plat;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-20(4)(g): Title 58, Chapter 22, Professional Engineers and Professional Land Surveyors Licensing Act has been certified and signed by a professional land surveyor licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-20(4)(h): has been reviewed and signed by the approving authority of the local entity whose boundary is depicted on the plat.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-20(5): The county surveyor may charge and collect a reasonable fee for the costs associated with:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-20(5)(a): the process of determining whether a plat is a final local entity plat; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-23-20(5)(b): the approval of a plat as a final local entity plat.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 17 - Chapter 24 - County Treasurer
**************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 17-24-1 General duties of treasurer.
----------------------------------------------------------
The county treasurer shall:Utah Code Annotated § 17-24-1(1): Title 11, Chapter 14, Local Government Bonding Act receive all money belonging to the county and all other money by law directed to be paid to the treasurer, including proceeds of bonds, notes, or other evidences of indebtedness issued under
Utah Code Annotated § 17-24-1(2): Title 51, Chapter 7, State Money Management Act deposit and invest all money received under
Utah Code Annotated § 17-24-1(3): keep a record of the receipts and expenditures of all such money;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-24-1(4): 17-19a-301; Chapter 36, Uniform Fiscal Procedures Act for Counties disburse county money:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-24-1(4)(a): on a county warrant issued by the county auditor; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-24-1(4)(b): 17-19a-301; Chapter 36, Uniform Fiscal Procedures Act for Counties subject to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-24-1(5): Title 59, Chapter 2, Part 13, Collection of Taxes perform the duties assigned to the treasurer under
Utah Code Annotated § 17-24-1(6): Title 59, Chapter 2, Part 13, Collection of Taxes; 17-16-5.5 perform the duties under
Utah Code Annotated § 17-24-1(7): 10-11-4; 17B-1-902 provide the notice required under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-24-1(8): perform other duties that are required by law or ordinance.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-24-4 Payment of warrants, checks, or other instruments.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-24-4(1): When a warrant is presented for payment and there is money in the treasury, the treasurer shall pay it.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-24-4(2): 17-19a-301 Upon receiving the notice from the county auditor under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-24-4(3): (1); (2); 17-20-1.7(4) Notwithstanding Subsections


Utah Code Annotated § 17-24-5 Payment of warrants in order presented -- Nonpayment of warrants -- Interest.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The county treasurer shall pay all warrants in the order presented and as funds are available.  When any warrant is presented to the treasurer for payment and is not paid for want of funds, the warrant shall bear interest at the rate of 5% per annum until paid.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-24-11 Monthly reconciliations with auditor.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
The county treasurer shall reconcile with the county auditor by the last day of each month for the preceding month.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-24-12 Reports to county executive or legislative body.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Each county treasurer shall make a detailed report whenever required so to do by the county executive or by the legislative body at any of their regular or special meetings of all money received by the treasurer, and of disbursements thereof, and of all other proceedings in the treasurer's office so that the receipts into the treasury and the amount of disbursements shall clearly and distinctly appear.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-24-19 Examination of records.
------------------------------------------------------
The books, accounts, and vouchers of the treasurer are at all times subject to the inspection and examination of the county executive and county legislative body, the county attorney, the district attorney, the county auditor, and the grand jury.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-24-21 Seal of county treasurers.
---------------------------------------------------------
The county treasurer of each county shall have an official seal to be provided by the county legislative body with which to authenticate his official acts and records. It shall have inscribed thereon the words "County Treasurer -- Official Seal" and the name of the county in which the treasurer holds office.

Utah Code Annotated - Title 17 - Chapter 25 - Powers and Duties of Constables
*****************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 17-25-1 General powers and duties.
--------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25-1(1): A constable shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25-1(1)(a): attend the justice courts within the constable's city or county when required by contract or court order; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25-1(1)(b): execute, serve, and return all process directed or delivered to the constable by a judge of the justice court serving the city or county, or by any competent authority within the limits of this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25-1(2): A constable may:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25-1(2)(a): serve any process throughout the state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25-1(2)(b): carry out all other functions associated with a constable.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25-1(3): A constable shall serve exclusively as an agent for:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25-1(3)(a): the state, city, or county that has a contract with the constable; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25-1(3)(b): the court authorizing or directing the constable.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25-1(4): Except as otherwise provided in this part, a constable may not serve as an agent, or be deemed to be serving as an agent, for a person that is not described in Subsection (3).


Utah Code Annotated § 17-25-2 Fees for constables -- Civil.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25-2(1): 17-22-2.5 Constables may for their own use collect as compensation in civil matters the same fees as those specified for sheriffs in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25-2(2): 17-22-2.5 Constable fees that exceed the amounts in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25-2(2)(a): by the constable only if he has received prior approval for the increased fee from the party requesting the service; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25-2(2)(b): by prevailing party as a cost of the action only if the court finds the service and increased fee are justifiable.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-25-3 Fees for constables -- Criminal.
--------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25-3(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25-3(1)(a): In criminal matters constables shall be paid for each copy of a summons, subpoena, notice, court order, or other criminal paper, except a warrant of arrest;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25-3(1)(a)(i): $5 for each defendant served; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25-3(1)(a)(ii): mileage of $1 per mile for each mile necessarily traveled in going only, to be computed from either the courthouse, or when transmitted by mail, from the post office where received.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25-3(1)(b): If more than one trip is necessary to serve, or diligently attempt to serve, service of process, mileage charges for more than two trips may be collected only if the party requesting the service of process has approved the additional mileage charges.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25-3(1)(c): Each charge shall be individually documented on the affidavit of return of service.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25-3(2): Lower charges may be established by contract for services under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25-3(3): If a constable serves process in a county other than the county where the process originated, travel expenses may not exceed the fee that would be charged if served by the sheriff of that county.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25-3(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25-3(4)(a): For each mile traveled for the purpose of serving, or to diligently attempt service of, a warrant of arrest, both in going to and returning from defendant's address, a fee of $1 may be charged.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25-3(4)(b): If more than one trip is necessary to serve, or diligently attempt to serve, a warrant of arrest, no more than two additional mileage charges may be collected.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25-3(4)(c): Each charge shall be individually documented on the affidavit of return of service.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25-3(5): For arresting each prisoner and bringing him into court, or otherwise satisfying a warrant, a fee of $15 may be charged.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-25-4 Constables' fees in criminal cases -- Procedure.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Accounts against the county filed by constables for services in criminal cases shall be certified as correct by the county attorney or district attorney and shall be presented to the auditor.  The county legislative body may reject such bills in all causes or proceedings in which the county attorney or district attorney has not in writing authorized the issuance of the warrant of arrest.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-25-5 Contracts for constable services.
---------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25-5(1): The governing body of a municipality or county where a justice court exists may contract with a constable to provide services in criminal cases for the contracting governmental entity by a method and for an amount mutually agreed upon.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25-5(2): (1); (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25-5(2)(a): (1) A contract between a governing body and a constable, including a contract described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25-5(2)(b): (2)(a) A contract described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 17-25-6 Identification of constables -- Uniform requirements.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25-6(1): 17-25-1 While performing a duty described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25-6(1)(a): a person as a constable;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25-6(1)(b): the person's name; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25-6(1)(c): the county or municipality for which the constable is appointed.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25-6(2): If a constable serves process, the constable shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25-6(2)(a): verbally communicate to the person being served that the constable is a constable; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25-6(2)(b): print on the first page of each document served:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25-6(2)(b)(i): the constable's name and identification as a constable;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25-6(2)(b)(ii): the county or municipality for which the constable is appointed; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25-6(2)(b)(iii): a business phone number for the constable.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25-6(3): If a constable wears a uniform, the uniform shall be clearly marked with the word "constable" on the uniform shirt and, if applicable, the jacket.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-25a-2 Constable -- Qualifications -- Duties.
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25a-2(1): To qualify as a constable, a person shall be certified as a special function peace officer in the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25a-2(2): A constable shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25a-2(2)(a): avoid all conflicts of interest; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25a-2(2)(b): maintain a public office and be accessible to the public and to the court during the hours the court is open.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-25a-3 County and city constables -- Terms -- Authority -- Deputies.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25a-3(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25a-3(1)(a): Constables appointed by a county or city are appointed for terms of six years and may serve more than one term if reappointed by the appointing body.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25a-3(1)(b): Notwithstanding the law in place at the time a constable was appointed, the term of a constable appointed on or after July 1, 2018, expires six years after the day on which the term began.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25a-3(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25a-3(2)(a): Constables serving process outside the county in which they are appointed shall contact the sheriff's office or police department of the jurisdiction prior to serving executions or seizing any property.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25a-3(2)(b): A constable or deputy constable shall notify the agency of jurisdiction by contacting the sheriff's office or police department of jurisdiction before serving a warrant of arrest.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25a-3(3): The appointed constable may, upon approval of the appointing county or city, employ and deputize persons who are certified as special function peace officers to function as deputy constables.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25a-3(4): If the county or city appointing body withdraws the authority of a constable, the authority of all deputy constables is also withdrawn.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25a-3(5): 53-6-209 If the authority of a constable or deputy constable is withdrawn, notification of the Peace Officer Standards and Training Division of the Department of Public Safety shall be made pursuant to Section


Utah Code Annotated § 17-25a-4 Rates recoverable -- Exception.
--------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25a-4(1): 17-22-2.5; 17-25-3; 17-25-5 The rates recoverable through court action for service of process by a constable are governed by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25a-4(2): 17-22-2.5 Constable fees that exceed the amounts in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25a-4(2)(a): by the constable only if he has received prior approval for the increased fee from the party requesting the service; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-25a-4(2)(b): by a prevailing party as a cost of the action only if the court finds the service and increased fee are justifiable.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 17 - Chapter 26 - County Hospitals
**************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 17-26-1 Jurisdiction transferred to commissioners.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
All county hospitals established under Chapter 106, Laws of 1917, shall hereafter be under the jurisdiction of the county legislative body, and the office of trustees therefor is abolished.

Utah Code Annotated - Title 17 - Chapter 27a - County Land Use, Development, and Management Act
***********************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-101 Title.
---------------------------------------
This chapter is  known as the "County Land Use, Development, and Management Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-102 Purposes -- General land use authority -- Limitations.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-102(1): (4); 11-41-103
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-102(1)(a): The purposes of this chapter are to:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-102(1)(a)(i): provide for the health, safety, and welfare;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-102(1)(a)(ii): promote the prosperity;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-102(1)(a)(iii): improve the morals, peace, good order, comfort, convenience, and aesthetics of each county and each county's present and future inhabitants and businesses;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-102(1)(a)(iv): protect the tax base;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-102(1)(a)(v): secure economy in governmental expenditures;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-102(1)(a)(vi): foster the state's agricultural and other industries;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-102(1)(a)(vii): protect both urban and nonurban development;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-102(1)(a)(viii): protect and ensure access to sunlight for solar energy devices;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-102(1)(a)(ix): provide fundamental fairness in land use regulation;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-102(1)(a)(x): facilitate orderly growth and allow growth in a variety of housing types; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-102(1)(a)(xi): protect property values.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-102(1)(b): (4); 11-41-103 Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-102(1)(b)(i): uses;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-102(1)(b)(ii): density;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-102(1)(b)(iii): open spaces;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-102(1)(b)(iv): structures;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-102(1)(b)(v): buildings;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-102(1)(b)(vi): energy-efficiency;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-102(1)(b)(vii): light and air;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-102(1)(b)(viii): air quality;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-102(1)(b)(ix): transportation and public or alternative transportation;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-102(1)(b)(x): infrastructure;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-102(1)(b)(xi): street and building orientation and width requirements;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-102(1)(b)(xii): public facilities;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-102(1)(b)(xiii): fundamental fairness in land use regulation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-102(1)(b)(xiv): considerations of surrounding land uses to balance the foregoing purposes with a landowner's private property interests and associated statutory and constitutional protections.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-102(2): Each county shall comply with the mandatory provisions of this part before any agreement or contract to provide goods, services, or municipal-type services to any storage facility or transfer facility for high-level nuclear waste, or greater than class C radioactive waste, may be executed or implemented.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-102(3): 40-6-2.5; 40-6-2.5
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-102(3)(a): 40-6-2.5 Any ordinance, resolution, or rule enacted by a county pursuant to its authority under this chapter shall comply with the state's exclusive jurisdiction to regulate oil and gas activity, as described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-102(3)(b): 40-6-2.5 A county may enact an ordinance, resolution, or rule that regulates surface activity incident to an oil and gas activity if the county demonstrates that the regulation:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-102(3)(b)(i): is necessary for the purposes of this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-102(3)(b)(ii): does not effectively or unduly limit, ban, or prohibit an oil and gas activity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-102(3)(b)(iii): 40-6-2.5 does not interfere with the state's exclusive jurisdiction to regulate oil and gas activity, as described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-102(4): (4); Title 10, Chapter 2, Part 4, Annexation; (4)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-102(4)(a): (4) This Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-102(4)(b): Title 10, Chapter 2, Part 4, Annexation A provision in a county development agreement is unenforceable if the provision requires an individual or an entity, as a condition for issuing building permits or otherwise regulating development activities within an unincorporated area of the county, to initiate a process for a municipality to annex the unincorporated area in accordance with
