Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(1): "Accessory dwelling unit" means a habitable living unit added to, created within, or detached from a primary single-family dwelling and contained on one lot.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(2): "Adversely affected party" means a person other than a land use applicant who:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(2)(a): owns real property adjoining the property that is the subject of a land use application or land use decision; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(2)(b): will suffer a damage different in kind than, or an injury distinct from, that of the general community as a result of the land use decision.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(3): "Affected entity" means a county, municipality, special district, special service district under Title 17D, Chapter 1, Special Service District Act, school district, interlocal cooperation entity established under Title 11, Chapter 13, Interlocal Cooperation Act, specified property owner, property owner's association, public utility, or the Department of Transportation, if:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(3)(a): the entity's services or facilities are likely to require expansion or significant modification because of an intended use of land;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(3)(b): the entity has filed with the county a copy of the entity's general or long-range plan; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(3)(c): the entity has filed with the county a request for notice during the same calendar year and before the county provides notice to an affected entity in compliance with a requirement imposed under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(4): 20A-7-601; 20A-7-602.8 "Affected owner" means the owner of real property that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(4)(a): a single project;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(4)(b): 20A-7-601 the subject of a land use approval that sponsors of a referendum timely challenged in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(4)(c): 20A-7-602.8 determined to be legally referable under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(5): "Appeal authority" means the person, board, commission, agency, or other body designated by ordinance to decide an appeal of a decision of a land use application or a variance.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(6): "Billboard" means a freestanding ground sign located on industrial, commercial, or residential property if the sign is designed or intended to direct attention to a business, product, or service that is not sold, offered, or existing on the property where the sign is located.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(7): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(7)(a): "Charter school" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(7)(a)(i): an operating charter school;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(7)(a)(ii): a charter school applicant that a charter school authorizer approves in accordance with Title 53G, Chapter 5, Part 3, Charter School Authorization; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(7)(a)(iii): an entity that is working on behalf of a charter school or approved charter applicant to develop or construct a charter school building.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(7)(b): "Charter school" does not include a therapeutic school.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(8): "Chief executive officer" means the person or body that exercises the executive powers of the county.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(9): "Conditional use" means a land use that, because of the unique characteristics or potential impact of the land use on the county, surrounding neighbors, or adjacent land uses, may not be compatible in some areas or may be compatible only if certain conditions are required that mitigate or eliminate the detrimental impacts.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(10): "Constitutional taking" means a governmental action that results in a taking of private property so that compensation to the owner of the property is required by the:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(10)(a): Fifth or Fourteenth Amendment of the Constitution of the United States; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(10)(b): Utah Constitution, Article I, Section 22.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(11): 54-3-27 "County utility easement" means an easement that:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(11)(a): a plat recorded in a county recorder's office described as a county utility easement or otherwise as a utility easement;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(11)(b): 54-3-27 is not a protected utility easement or a public utility easement as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(11)(c): the county or the county's affiliated governmental entity owns or creates; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(11)(d): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(11)(d)(i): either:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(11)(d)(i)(A): no person uses or occupies; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(11)(d)(i)(B): the county or the county's affiliated governmental entity uses and occupies to provide a utility service, including sanitary sewer, culinary water, electrical, storm water, or communications or data lines; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(11)(d)(ii): a person uses or occupies with or without an authorized franchise or other agreement with the county.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(12): "Culinary water authority" means the department, agency, or public entity with responsibility to review and approve the feasibility of the culinary water system and sources for the subject property.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(13): "Development activity" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(13)(a): any construction or expansion of a building, structure, or use that creates additional demand and need for public facilities;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(13)(b): any change in use of a building or structure that creates additional demand and need for public facilities; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(13)(c): any change in the use of land that creates additional demand and need for public facilities.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(14): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(14)(a): "Development agreement" means a written agreement or amendment to a written agreement between a county and one or more parties that regulates or controls the use or development of a specific area of land.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(14)(b): "Development agreement" does not include an improvement completion assurance.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(15): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(15)(a): "Disability" means a physical or mental impairment that substantially limits one or more of a person's major life activities, including a person having a record of such an impairment or being regarded as having such an impairment.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(15)(b): "Disability" does not include current illegal use of, or addiction to, any federally controlled substance, as defined in Section 102 of the Controlled Substances Act, 21 U.S.C. Sec. 802.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(16): "Educational facility":
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(16)(a): means:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(16)(a)(i): a school district's building at which pupils assemble to receive instruction in a program for any combination of grades from preschool through grade 12, including kindergarten and a program for children with disabilities;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(16)(a)(ii): a structure or facility:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(16)(a)(ii)(A): located on the same property as a building described in Subsection (16)(a)(i); and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(16)(a)(ii)(B): used in support of the use of that building; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(16)(a)(iii): a building to provide office and related space to a school district's administrative personnel; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(16)(b): does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(16)(b)(i): land or a structure, including land or a structure for inventory storage, equipment storage, food processing or preparing, vehicle storage or maintenance, or similar use that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(16)(b)(i)(A): not located on the same property as a building described in Subsection (16)(a)(i); and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(16)(b)(i)(B): used in support of the purposes of a building described in Subsection (16)(a)(i); or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(16)(b)(ii): a therapeutic school.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(17): "Fire authority" means the department, agency, or public entity with responsibility to review and approve the feasibility of fire protection and suppression services for the subject property.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(18): "Flood plain" means land that:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(18)(a): is within the 100-year flood plain designated by the Federal Emergency Management Agency; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(18)(b): has not been studied or designated by the Federal Emergency Management Agency but presents a likelihood of experiencing chronic flooding or a catastrophic flood event because the land has characteristics that are similar to those of a 100-year flood plain designated by the Federal Emergency Management Agency.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(19): 54-2-1 "Gas corporation" has the same meaning as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(20): "General plan" means a document that a county adopts that sets forth general guidelines for proposed future development of:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(20)(a): the unincorporated land within the county; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(20)(b): for a mountainous planning district, the land within the mountainous planning district.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(21): "Geologic hazard" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(21)(a): a surface fault rupture;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(21)(b): shallow groundwater;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(21)(c): liquefaction;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(21)(d): a landslide;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(21)(e): a debris flow;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(21)(f): unstable soil;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(21)(g): a rock fall; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(21)(h): any other geologic condition that presents a risk:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(21)(h)(i): to life;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(21)(h)(ii): of substantial loss of real property; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(21)(h)(iii): of substantial damage to real property.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(22): 53G-6-201 "Home-based microschool" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(23): "Hookup fee" means a fee for the installation and inspection of any pipe, line, meter, or appurtenance to connect to a county water, sewer, storm water, power, or other utility system.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(24): "Identical plans" means building plans submitted to a county that:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(24)(a): are clearly marked as "identical plans";
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(24)(b): are substantially identical building plans that were previously submitted to and reviewed and approved by the county; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(24)(c): describe a building that:

Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(25): "Impact fee" means a payment of money imposed under Title 11, Chapter 36a, Impact Fees Act.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(26): "Improvement completion assurance" means a surety bond, letter of credit, financial institution bond, cash, assignment of rights, lien, or other equivalent security required by a county to guaranty the proper completion of landscaping or an infrastructure improvement required as a condition precedent to:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(26)(a): recording a subdivision plat; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(26)(b): development of a commercial, industrial, mixed use, or multifamily project.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(27): "Improvement warranty" means an applicant's unconditional warranty that the applicant's installed and accepted landscaping or infrastructure improvement:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(27)(a): complies with the county's written standards for design, materials, and workmanship; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(27)(b): will not fail in any material respect, as a result of poor workmanship or materials, within the improvement warranty period.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(28): "Improvement warranty period" means a period:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(28)(a): no later than one year after a county's acceptance of required landscaping; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(28)(b): no later than one year after a county's acceptance of required infrastructure, unless the county:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(28)(b)(i): determines for good cause that a one-year period would be inadequate to protect the public health, safety, and welfare; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(28)(b)(ii): has substantial evidence, on record:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(28)(b)(ii)(A): of prior poor performance by the applicant; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(28)(b)(ii)(B): that the area upon which the infrastructure will be constructed contains suspect soil and the county has not otherwise required the applicant to mitigate the suspect soil.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(29): "Infrastructure improvement" means permanent infrastructure that is essential for the public health and safety or that:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(29)(a): is required for human consumption; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(29)(b): an applicant must install:

Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(29)(b)(ii)(C): developing a commercial, industrial, mixed use, condominium, or multifamily project.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(31): "Interstate pipeline company" means a person or entity engaged in natural gas transportation subject to the jurisdiction of the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission under the Natural Gas Act, 15 U.S.C. Sec. 717 et seq.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(33): "Land use applicant" means a property owner, or the property owner's designee, who submits a land use application regarding the property owner's land.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(34): "Land use application":
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(34)(a): means an application that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(34)(a)(i): required by a county; and

Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(36)(a): a land use permit;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(36)(b): a land use application; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(36)(c): the enforcement of a land use regulation, land use permit, or development agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(37): "Land use permit" means a permit issued by a land use authority.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(38): "Land use regulation":
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(38)(a): means a legislative decision enacted by ordinance, law, code, map, resolution, specification, fee, or rule that governs the use or development of land;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(38)(b): includes the adoption or amendment of a zoning map or the text of the zoning code; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(38)(c): does not include:

Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(38)(c)(ii)(A): increase a land use applicant's cost of development compared to the existing specification; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(38)(c)(ii)(B): impact a land use applicant's use of land.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(39): "Legislative body" means the county legislative body, or for a county that has adopted an alternative form of government, the body exercising legislative powers.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(40): "Lot" means a tract of land, regardless of any label, that is created by and shown on a subdivision plat that has been recorded in the office of the county recorder.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-103(41): 17-27a-608

Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-201 Required notice.
-------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-201(1): At a minimum, each county shall provide actual notice or the notice required by this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-201(2): A county may by ordinance require greater notice than required under this part.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-202 Applicant notice -- Waiver of requirements.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-202(1): For each land use application, the county shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-202(1)(a): notify the applicant of the date, time, and place of each public hearing and public meeting to consider the application;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-202(1)(b): provide to each applicant a copy of each staff report regarding the applicant or the pending application at least three business days before the public hearing or public meeting; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-202(1)(c): notify the applicant of any final action on a pending application.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-202(2): (1)(a); (b) If a county fails to comply with the requirements of Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-303 Entrance upon land.
----------------------------------------------------
A county may enter upon any land at reasonable times to make examinations and surveys pertinent to the:Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-303(1): preparation of its general plan; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-303(2): preparation or enforcement of its land use ordinances.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-304 State and federal property.
------------------------------------------------------------
Unless otherwise provided by law, nothing contained in this chapter may be construed as giving a county jurisdiction over property owned by the state or the United States.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-305 Other entities required to conform to county's land use ordinances -- Exceptions -- School districts, charter schools, home-based microschools, and micro-education entities -- Submission of development plan and schedule.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-305(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-305(1)(a): Each county, municipality, school district, charter school, special district, special service district, and political subdivision of the state shall conform to any applicable land use ordinance of any county when installing, constructing, operating, or otherwise using any area, land, or building situated within a mountainous planning district or the unincorporated portion of the county, as applicable.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-305(1)(b): In addition to any other remedies provided by law, when a county's land use ordinance is violated or about to be violated by another political subdivision, that county may institute an injunction, mandamus, abatement, or other appropriate action or proceeding to prevent, enjoin, abate, or remove the improper installation, improvement, or use.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-305(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-305(2)(a): Except as provided in Subsection (3), a school district or charter school is subject to a county's land use ordinances.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-305(2)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-305(2)(b)(i): Notwithstanding Subsection (3), a county may:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-305(2)(b)(i)(A): subject a charter school to standards within each zone pertaining to setback, height, bulk and massing regulations, off-site parking, curb cut, traffic circulation, and construction staging; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-305(2)(b)(i)(B): impose regulations upon the location of a project that are necessary to avoid unreasonable risks to health or safety, as provided in Subsection (3)(f).
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-305(2)(b)(ii): The standards to which a county may subject a charter school under Subsection (2)(b)(i) shall be objective standards only and may not be subjective.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-305(2)(b)(iii): Except as provided in Subsection (7)(d), the only basis upon which a county may deny or withhold approval of a charter school's land use application is the charter school's failure to comply with a standard imposed under Subsection (2)(b)(i).
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-305(2)(b)(iv): Nothing in Subsection (2)(b)(iii) may be construed to relieve a charter school of an obligation to comply with a requirement of an applicable building or safety code to which it is otherwise obligated to comply.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-305(3): A county may not:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-305(3)(a): impose requirements for landscaping, fencing, aesthetic considerations, construction methods or materials, additional building inspections, county building codes, building use for educational purposes, or the placement or use of temporary classroom facilities on school property;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-305(3)(b): except as otherwise provided in this section, require a school district or charter school to participate in the cost of any roadway or sidewalk, or a study on the impact of a school on a roadway or sidewalk, that is not reasonably necessary for the safety of school children and not located on or contiguous to school property, unless the roadway or sidewalk is required to connect an otherwise isolated school site to an existing roadway;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-305(3)(c): require a district or charter school to pay fees not authorized by this section;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-305(3)(d): provide for inspection of school construction or assess a fee or other charges for inspection, unless the school district or charter school is unable to provide for inspection by an inspector, other than the project architect or contractor, who is qualified under criteria established by the state superintendent;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-305(3)(e): require a school district or charter school to pay any impact fee for an improvement project unless the impact fee is imposed as provided in Title 11, Chapter 36a, Impact Fees Act;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-305(3)(f): impose regulations upon the location of an educational facility except as necessary to avoid unreasonable risks to health or safety; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-305(3)(g): for a land use or a structure owned or operated by a school district or charter school that is not an educational facility but is used in support of providing instruction to pupils, impose a regulation that:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-305(3)(g)(i): is not imposed on a similar land use or structure in the zone in which the land use or structure is approved; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-305(3)(g)(ii): uses the tax exempt status of the school district or charter school as criteria for prohibiting or regulating the land use or location of the structure.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-305(4): 53E-3-710 Subject to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-305(4)(a): avoid or mitigate existing and potential traffic hazards, including consideration of the impacts between the new school and future highways; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-305(4)(b): maximize school, student, and site safety.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-305(5): Notwithstanding Subsection (3)(d), a county may, at its discretion:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-305(5)(a): provide a walk-through of school construction at no cost and at a time convenient to the district or charter school; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-305(5)(b): provide recommendations based upon the walk-through.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-305(6): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-305(6)(a): Notwithstanding Subsection (3)(d), a school district or charter school shall use:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-305(6)(a)(i): a county building inspector;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-305(6)(a)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-305(6)(a)(ii)(A): for a school district, a school district building inspector from that school district; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-305(6)(a)(ii)(B): for a charter school, a school district building inspector from the school district in which the charter school is located; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-305(6)(a)(iii): an independent, certified building inspector who isnot an employee of the contractor, licensed to perform the inspection that the inspector is requested to perform, andapproved bya county building inspector or:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-305(6)(a)(iii)(A): for a school district, a school district building inspector from that school district; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-305(6)(a)(iii)(B): for a charter school, a school district building inspector from the school district in which the charter school is located.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-305(6)(b): The approval under Subsection (6)(a)(iii) may not be unreasonably withheld.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-305(6)(c): If a school district or charter school uses a school district or independent building inspector under Subsection (6)(a)(ii) or (iii), the school district or charter school shall submit to the state superintendent of public instruction and county building official, on a monthly basis during construction of the school building, a copy of each inspection certificate regarding the school building.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-305(7): 53E-3-706; 53E-3-706; 53E-3-706; 15A-2-103; 15A-2-103; 15A-1-210
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-305(7)(a): A charter school, home-based microschool, or micro-education entity shall be considered a permitted use in all zoning districts within a county.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-305(7)(b): Each land use application for any approval required for a charter school, home-based microschool, or micro-education entity, including an application for a building permit, shall be processed on a first priority basis.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-305(7)(c): Parking requirements for a charter school or micro-education entity may not exceed the minimum parking requirements for schools or other institutional public uses throughout the county.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-305(7)(d): If a county has designated zones for a sexually oriented business, or a business which sells alcohol, a charter school or micro-education entity may be prohibited from a location which would otherwise defeat the purpose for the zone unless the charter school or micro-education entity provides a waiver.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-305(7)(e): 53E-3-706; 53E-3-706; 53E-3-706
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-305(7)(e)(i): 53E-3-706 A school district , charter school, or micro-education entity may seek a certificate authorizing permanent occupancy of a school building from:

Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-306(1)(b)(ii): is contiguous; and

Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-306(5)(a): If a portion of an area located within a planning advisory area is annexed by a municipality or incorporates, that portion is withdrawn from the planning advisory area.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-306(5)(b): If a planning advisory area in whole is annexed by a municipality or incorporates, the planning advisory area is dissolved.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-308 Land use authority requirements -- Nature of land use decision.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-308(1): A land use authority shall apply the plain language of land use regulations.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-308(2): If a land use regulation does not plainly restrict a land use application, the land use authority shall interpret and apply the land use regulation to favor the land use application.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-308(3): A land use decision of a land use authority is an administrative act, even if the land use authority is the legislative body.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-401 General plan required -- Content -- Resource management plan -- Provisions related to radioactive waste facility.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-401(1): To accomplish the purposes of this chapter, a county shall prepare and adopt a comprehensive, long-range general plan:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-401(1)(a): for present and future needs of the county;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-401(1)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-401(1)(b)(i): for growth and development of all or any part of the land within the unincorporated portions of the county; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-401(1)(b)(ii): if a county has designated a mountainous planning district, for growth and development of all or any part of the land within the mountainous planning district; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-401(1)(c): as a basis for communicating and coordinating with the federal government on land and resource management issues.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-401(2): To promote health, safety, and welfare, the  general plan may provide for:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-401(2)(a): health, general welfare, safety, energy conservation, transportation, prosperity, civic activities, aesthetics, and recreational, educational, and cultural opportunities;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-401(2)(b): the reduction of the waste of physical, financial, or human resources that result from either excessive congestion or excessive scattering of population;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-401(2)(c): the efficient and economical use, conservation, and production of the supply of:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-401(2)(c)(i): food and water; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-401(2)(c)(ii): drainage, sanitary, and other facilities and resources;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-401(2)(d): the use of energy conservation and solar and clean energy resources;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-401(2)(e): the protection of urban development;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-401(2)(f): the protection and promotion of air quality;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-401(2)(g): historic preservation;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-401(2)(h): identifying future uses of land that are likely to require an expansion or significant modification of services or facilities provided by an affected entity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-401(2)(i): an official map.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-403(2)(a): 17-27a-408; 17-27a-401 At a minimum, the proposed general plan, with the accompanying maps, charts, and descriptive and explanatory matter, shall include the planning commission's recommendations for the following plan elements:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-403(2)(a)(i): a land use element that:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-403(2)(a)(i)(A): designates the long-term goals and the proposed extent, general distribution, and location of land for housing for residents of various income levels, business, industry, agriculture, recreation, education, public buildings and grounds, open space, and other categories of public and private uses of land as appropriate;

Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-403(2)(a)(ii)(C): correlates with the population projections, the employment projections, and the proposed land use element of the general plan;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-403(2)(a)(iii): 17-27a-408 for a specified county as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-403(2)(a)(iii)(A): provides a realistic opportunity to meet the need for additional moderate income housing within the next five years;

Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-403(2)(b): 10-9a-530 In drafting the moderate income housing element, the planning commission:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-403(2)(b)(i): shall consider the Legislature's determination that counties should facilitate a reasonable opportunity for a variety of housing, including moderate income housing:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-403(2)(b)(i)(A): to meet the needs of people of various income levels living, working, or desiring to live or work in the community; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-403(2)(b)(i)(B): to allow people with various incomes to benefit from and fully participate in all aspects of neighborhood and community life; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-403(2)(b)(ii): 10-9a-530 shall include an analysis of how the county will provide a realistic opportunity for the development of moderate income housing within the planning horizon, including a recommendation to implement three or more of the following moderate income housing strategies:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-403(2)(b)(ii)(A): rezone for densities necessary to facilitate the production of moderate income housing;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-403(2)(b)(ii)(B): demonstrate investment in the rehabilitation or expansion of infrastructure that facilitates the construction of moderate income housing;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-403(2)(b)(ii)(C): demonstrate investment in the rehabilitation of existing uninhabitable housing stock into moderate income housing;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-403(2)(b)(ii)(D): identify and utilize county general fund subsidies or other sources of revenue to waive construction related fees that are otherwise generally imposed by the county for the construction or rehabilitation of moderate income housing;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-403(2)(b)(ii)(E): create or allow for, and reduce regulations related to, internal or detached accessory dwelling units in residential zones;

Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-403(2)(b)(ii)(G): amend land use regulations to allow for higher density or new moderate income residential development in commercial or mixed-use zones near major transit investment corridors;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-403(2)(b)(ii)(H): amend land use regulations to eliminate or reduce parking requirements for residential development where a resident is less likely to rely on the resident's own vehicle, such as residential development near major transit investment corridors or senior living facilities;

Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-403(2)(b)(ii)(K): preserve existing and new moderate income housing and subsidized units by utilizing a landlord incentive program, providing for deed restricted units through a grant program, or establishing a housing loss mitigation fund;

Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-403(2)(b)(ii)(O): apply for or partner with an entity that applies for state or federal funds or tax incentives to promote the construction of moderate income housing, an entity that applies for programs offered by the Utah Housing Corporation within that agency's funding capacity, an entity that applies for affordable housing programs administered by the Department of Workforce Services, an entity that applies for services provided by a public housing authority to preserve and create moderate income housing, or any other entity that applies for programs or services that promote the construction or preservation of moderate income housing;

Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-403(2)(h)(ix)(E): reduction of yard waste; and

Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-405 Effect of general plan -- Coordination with federal government.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-405(1): 17-27a-401(4)(b); 17-27a-406; (3) Except for the mandatory provisions in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-405(2): 17-27a-401(4)(b) The legislative body may adopt an ordinance mandating compliance with the general plan, and shall adopt an ordinance requiring compliance with all provisions of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-405(3): (3); (3)(c)(iv)
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-405(3)(a): (3) As used in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-405(3)(a)(i): work with a county on the matter to achieve a consistent outcome;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-405(3)(a)(ii): make resource management plans in conjunction with a county on the matter;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-405(3)(a)(iii): make resource management plans consistent with a county's plans on the matter;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-405(3)(a)(iv): integrate a county's plans on the matter into the federal government's plans; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-405(3)(a)(v): follow a county's plans when contemplating any action on the matter.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-405(3)(b): If the federal government is required to coordinate with a county or a local government on a matter, the county's general plan is the principle document through which the coordination shall take place.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-405(3)(c): (3)(c)(iv) The federal government is not considered to have coordinated with a county or a local government on a matter unless the federal government has:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-405(3)(c)(i): kept the county apprised of the federal government's proposed plans, amendments, policy changes, and management actions with regard to the matter;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-405(3)(c)(ii): worked with the county in developing and implementing plans, policies, and management actions on the matter;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-405(3)(c)(iii): treated the county as an equal partner in negotiations related to the matter;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-405(3)(c)(iv): listened to and understood the county's position on the matter to determine whether a conflict exists between the federal government's proposed plan, policy, rule, or action and the county's general plan;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-405(3)(c)(v): worked with the county in an amicable manner to reconcile any differences or disagreements, to the greatest extent possible under federal law, between the federal government and the county with regards to plans, policies, rules, or proposed management actions that relate to the matter;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-405(3)(c)(vi): (3)(c)(iv) engaged in a good-faith effort to reconcile any conflicts discovered under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-405(3)(c)(vii): given full consideration to a county's general plan to the extent that the general plan addresses the matter.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-406 Public uses to conform to general plan.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
After the legislative body has adopted a general plan, no street, park, or other public way, ground, place, or space, no publicly owned building or structure, and no public utility, whether publicly or privately owned, may be constructed or authorized until and unless it conforms to the current general plan.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-505 Zoning districts.
--------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-505(1): Title 19, Chapter 5, Water Quality Act
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-505(1)(a): The legislative body may divide the territory over which it has jurisdiction into zoning districts of a number, shape, and area that it considers appropriate to carry out the purposes of this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-505(1)(b): Within those zoning districts, the legislative body may regulate and restrict the erection, construction, reconstruction, alteration, repair, or use of buildings and structures, and the use of land.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-505(1)(c): A county may enact an ordinance regulating land use and development in a flood plain or potential geologic hazard area to:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-505(1)(c)(i): protect life; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-505(1)(c)(ii): prevent:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-505(1)(c)(ii)(A): the substantial loss of real property; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-505(1)(c)(ii)(B): substantial damage to real property.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-505(1)(d): Title 19, Chapter 5, Water Quality Act A county of the second, third, fourth, fifth, or sixth class may not adopt a land use ordinance requiring a property owner to revegetate or landscape a single family dwelling disturbance area unless the property is located in a flood zone or geologic hazard except as required in
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-505(2): The legislative body shall ensure that the regulations are uniform for each class or kind of buildings throughout each zone, but the regulations in one zone may differ from those in other zones.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-505(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-505(3)(a): There is no minimum area or diversity of ownership requirement for a zone designation.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-505(3)(b): Neither the size of a zoning district nor the number of landowners within the district may be used as evidence of the illegality of a zoning district or of the invalidity of a county decision.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-505(4): A county may by ordinance exempt from specific zoning district standards a subdivision of land to accommodate the siting of a public utility infrastructure.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-505.5 Limit on single family designation.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-505.5(1): As used in this section, "single-family limit" means the number of individuals allowed to occupy each residential unit that is recognized by a land use authority in a zone permitting occupancy by a single family.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-505.5(2): A county may not adopt a single-family limit that is less than:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-505.5(2)(a): three, if the county has within its unincorporated area:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-505.5(2)(a)(i): a state university;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-505.5(2)(a)(ii): a private university with a student population of at least 20,000; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-505.5(2)(a)(iii): a mountainous planning district; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-505.5(2)(b): four, for each other county.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-506 Conditional uses.
--------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-506(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-506(1)(a): A county may adopt a land use ordinance that includes conditional uses and provisions for conditional uses that require compliance with objective standards set forth in an applicable ordinance.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-506(1)(b): A county may not impose a requirement or standard on a conditional use that conflicts with a provision of this chapter or other state or federal law.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-506(2): (2)(a)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-506(2)(a): (2)(a)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-506(2)(a)(i): A land use authority shall approve a conditional use if reasonable conditions are proposed, or can be imposed, to mitigate the reasonably anticipated detrimental effects of the proposed use in accordance with applicable standards.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-506(2)(a)(ii): (2)(a)(i) The requirement described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-506(2)(b): If a land use authority proposes reasonable conditions on a proposed conditional use, the land use authority shall ensure that the conditions are stated on the record and reasonably relate to mitigating the anticipated detrimental effects of the proposed use.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-506(2)(c): If the reasonably anticipated detrimental effects of a proposed conditional use cannot be substantially mitigated by the proposal or the imposition of reasonable conditions to achieve compliance with applicable standards, the land use authority may deny the conditional use.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-506(3): A land use authority's decision to approve or deny a conditional use is an administrative land use decision.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-506(4): A legislative body shall classify any use that a land use regulation allows in a zoning district as either a permitted or conditional use under this chapter.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-508 Applicant's entitlement to land use application approval -- Application relating to land in a high priority transportation corridor -- County's requirements and limitations -- Vesting upon submission of development plan and schedule.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-508(1): 17-27a-504; 17B-1-102
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-508(1)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-508(1)(a)(i): An applicant who has submitted a complete land use application, including the payment of all application fees, is entitled to substantive review of the application under the land use regulations:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-508(1)(a)(i)(A): in effect on the date that the application is complete; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-508(1)(a)(i)(B): applicable to the application or to the information shown on the submitted application.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-508(1)(a)(ii): An applicant is entitled to approval of a land use application if the application conforms to the requirements of the applicable land use regulations, land use decisions, and development standards in effect when the applicant submits a complete application and pays all application fees, unless:

Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-510 Nonconforming uses and noncomplying structures.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-510(1): (1)
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-510(1)(a): Except as provided in this section, a nonconforming use or a noncomplying structure may be continued by the present or a future property owner.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-510(1)(b): A nonconforming use may be extended through the same building, provided no structural alteration of the building is proposed or made for the purpose of the extension.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-510(1)(c): (1) For purposes of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-510(2): The legislative body may provide for:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-510(2)(a): the establishment, restoration, reconstruction, extension, alteration, expansion, or substitution of nonconforming uses upon the terms and conditions set forth in the land use ordinance;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-510(2)(b): the termination of all nonconforming uses, except billboards, by providing a formula establishing a reasonable time period during which the owner can recover or amortize the amount of his investment in the nonconforming use, if any; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-510(2)(c): the termination of a nonconforming use due to its abandonment.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-510(3): 17-27a-512(2)
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-510(3)(a): A county may not prohibit the reconstruction or restoration of a noncomplying structure or terminate the nonconforming use of a structure that is involuntarily destroyed in whole or in part due to fire or other calamity unless the structure or use has been abandoned.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-510(3)(b): A county may prohibit the reconstruction or restoration of a noncomplying structure or terminate the nonconforming use of a structure if:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-510(3)(b)(i): the structure is allowed to deteriorate to a condition that the structure is rendered uninhabitable and is not repaired or restored within six months after the day on which written notice is served to the property owner that the structure is uninhabitable and that the noncomplying structure or nonconforming use will be lost if the structure is not repaired or restored within six months; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-510(3)(b)(ii): the property owner has voluntarily demolished a majority of the noncomplying structure or the building that houses the nonconforming use.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-510(3)(c): 17-27a-512(2)
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-510(3)(c)(i): Notwithstanding a prohibition in the county's zoning ordinance, a county may permit a billboard owner to relocate the billboard within the county's unincorporated area to a location that is mutually acceptable to the county and the billboard owner.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-512 County's acquisition of billboard by eminent domain -- Removal without providing compensation -- Limit on allowing nonconforming billboard to be rebuilt or replaced -- Validity of county permit after issuance of state permit.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-512(1): (1)(b)(ii) As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-512(1)(a): "Clearly visible" means capable of being read without obstruction by an occupant of a vehicle traveling on a street or highway within the visibility area.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-512(1)(b): (1)(b)(ii) "Highest allowable height" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-512(1)(b)(i): (1)(b)(ii) if the height allowed by the county, by ordinance or consent, is higher than the height under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-512(1)(b)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-512(1)(b)(ii)(A): for a noninterstate billboard:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-512(1)(b)(ii)(A)(I): if the height of the previous use or structure is 45 feet or higher, the height of the previous use or structure; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-512(1)(b)(ii)(A)(II): if the height of the previous use or structure is less than 45 feet, the height of the previous use or structure or the height to make the entire advertising content of the billboard clearly visible, whichever is higher, but no higher than 45 feet; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-512(1)(b)(ii)(B): for an interstate billboard:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-512(1)(b)(ii)(B)(I): if the height of the previous use or structure is at or above the interstate height, the height of the previous use or structure; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-512(1)(b)(ii)(B)(II): if the height of the previous use or structure is less than the interstate height, the height of the previous use or structure or the height to make the entire advertising content of the billboard clearly visible, whichever is higher, but no higher than the interstate height.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-512(1)(c): "Interstate billboard" means a billboard that is intended to be viewed from a highway that is an interstate.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-512(1)(d): "Interstate height" means a height that is the higher of:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-512(1)(d)(i): 65 feet above the ground; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-512(1)(d)(ii): 25 feet above the grade of the interstate.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-512(1)(e): "Noninterstate billboard" means a billboard that is intended to be viewed from a street or highway that is not an interstate.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-512(1)(f): "Visibility area" means the area on a street or highway that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-512(1)(f)(i): defined at one end by a line extending from the base of the billboard across all lanes of traffic of the street or highway in a plane that is perpendicular to the street or highway; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-512(1)(f)(ii): defined on the other end by a line extending across all lanes of traffic of the street or highway in a plane that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-512(1)(f)(ii)(A): perpendicular to the street or highway; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-512(1)(f)(ii)(B):

Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-512(1)(f)(ii)(B)(II): for a noninterstate billboard, 300 feet from the base of the billboard.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-513 Manufactured homes.
----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-513(1): 15A-1-302 For purposes of this section, a manufactured home is the same as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-513(2): A manufactured home may not be excluded from any land use zone or area in which a single-family residence would be permitted, provided the manufactured home  complies with all local land use ordinances, building codes, and any restrictive covenants, applicable to a single-family residence within that zone or area.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-513(3): A county may not:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-513(3)(a): adopt or enforce an ordinance or regulation that treats a proposed development that includes manufactured homes differently than one that does not include manufactured homes; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-513(3)(b): reject a development plan based on the fact that the development is expected to contain manufactured homes.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-514 Regulation of amateur radio antennas.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-514(1): A county may not enact or enforce an ordinance that does not comply with the ruling of the Federal Communications Commission in "Amateur Radio Preemption, 101 FCC 2nd 952 (1985)" or a regulation related to amateur radio service adopted under 47 C.F.R. Part 97.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-514(2): If a county adopts an ordinance involving the placement, screening, or height of an amateur radio antenna based on health, safety, or aesthetic conditions, the ordinance shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-514(2)(a): reasonably accommodate amateur radio communications; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-514(2)(b): represent the minimal practicable regulation to accomplish the county's purpose.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-515 Regulation of residential facilities for persons with disabilities.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A county may only regulate a residential facility for persons with a disability to the extent allowed by:Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-515(1): Title 57, Chapter 21, Utah Fair Housing Act
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-515(2): the Fair Housing Amendments Act of 1988, 42 U.S.C. Sec. 3601 et seq., and applicable jurisprudence; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-515(3): Section 504, Rehabilitation Act of 1973, and applicable jurisprudence.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-519 Licensing of residences for persons with a disability.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The responsibility to license programs or entities that operate facilities for persons with a disability, as well as to require and monitor the provision of adequate services to persons residing in those facilities, shall rest with the Department of Health and Human Services as provided in:Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-519(1): Title 26B, Chapter 2, Part 2, Health Care Facility Licensing and Inspection
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-519(2): Title 26B, Chapter 6, Part 4, Division of Services for People with Disabilities


Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-520 Wetlands.
------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-520(1): A county may not designate or treat any land as wetlands unless the United States Army Corps of Engineers or other agency of the federal government has designated the land as wetlands.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-520(2): 79-3-201 A land use authority that issues a land use permit that affects land designated as wetlands by the United States Army Corps of Engineers or another agency of the federal government shall provide a copy of the land use permit to the Utah Geological Survey established in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-521 Refineries.
--------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-521(1): As used in this section, "develop" or "development" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-521(1)(a): the construction, alteration, or improvement of land, including any related moving, demolition, or excavation outside of a refinery property boundary;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-521(1)(b): the subdivision of land for a non-industrial use; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-521(1)(c): the construction of a non-industrial structure on a parcel that is not subject to the subdivision process.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-521(2): Before a legislative body may adopt a non-industrial zoning change to permit development within 500 feet of a refinery boundary, the legislative body shall consult with the refinery to determine whether the proposed change is compatible with the refinery.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-521(3): Before a land use authority may approve an application to develop within 500 feet of a refinery boundary, the land use authority shall consult with the refinery to determine whether the development is compatible with the refinery.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-521(4): (2); (3) A legislative body described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-521(4)(a): proprietary information;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-521(4)(b): information, if made public, that would create a security or safety risk to the refinery or the public;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-521(4)(c): information that is restricted from public disclosure under federal or state law; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-521(4)(d): information that is available in public record.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-521(5): (2); (3)
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-521(5)(a): (2); (3) This section does not grant authority to a legislative body described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-521(5)(b): This section does not create a cause of action against a refinery.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-521(5)(c): Except as expressly provided in this section, this section does not alter or remove any legal right or obligation of a refinery.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-523 Boundary line agreement.
---------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-523(1): If properly executed and acknowledged as required by law, an agreement between owners of adjoining property that designates the boundary line between the adjoining properties acts, upon recording in the office of the recorder of the county in which each property is located, as a quitclaim deed to convey all of each party's right, title, interest, and estate in property outside the agreed boundary line that had been the subject of the boundary line agreement or dispute that led to the boundary line agreement.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-524 Site plan.
-------------------------------------------
A site plan submitted to a county for approval of a building permit:Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-524(1): if modified, may not be used to impose a penalty on a property owner;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-524(2): does not represent an agreement for a specific final layout;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-524(3): does not bind an owner from future development activity or modifications to a development activity on the property; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-524(4): is superseded by the terms of a building permit requirement.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-528(2)(e): A county may submit to a county recorder's office for recording:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-528(2)(e)(i): a fully executed agreement; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-528(2)(e)(ii): a document related to:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-528(2)(e)(ii)(A): code enforcement;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-528(2)(e)(ii)(B): a special assessment area;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-528(2)(e)(ii)(C): a local historic district boundary; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-528(2)(e)(ii)(D): the memorializing or enforcement of an agreed upon restriction, incentive, or covenant.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-528(2)(f): Subject to Subsection (2)(e), a county may not cause to be recorded against private real property a document that imposes development requirements, development regulations, or development controls on the property.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-532 Water wise landscaping.
--------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-532(1): As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-532(1)(a): "Lawn or turf" means nonagricultural land planted in closely mowed, managed grasses.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-532(1)(b): "Mulch" means material such as rock, bark, wood chips, or other materials left loose and applied to the soil.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-532(1)(c): "Overhead spray irrigation" means above ground irrigation heads that spray water through a nozzle.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-532(1)(d): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-532(1)(d)(i): "Vegetative coverage" means the ground level surface area covered by the exposed leaf area of a plant or group of plants at full maturity.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-532(1)(d)(ii): "Vegetative coverage" does not mean the ground level surface area covered by the exposed leaf area of a tree or trees.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-532(1)(e): "Water wise landscaping" means any or all of the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-532(1)(e)(i): installation of plant materials suited to the microclimate and soil conditions that can:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-532(1)(e)(i)(A): remain healthy with minimal irrigation once established; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-532(1)(e)(i)(B): be maintained without the use of overhead spray irrigation;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-532(1)(e)(ii): use of water for outdoor irrigation through proper and efficient irrigation design and water application; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-532(1)(e)(iii): the use of other landscape design features that:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-532(1)(e)(iii)(A): minimize the need of the landscape for supplemental water from irrigation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-532(1)(e)(iii)(B): reduce the landscape area dedicated to lawn or turf.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-532(2): A county may not enact or enforce an ordinance, resolution, or policy that prohibits, or has the effect of prohibiting, a property owner from incorporating water wise landscaping on the property owner's property.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-532(3): (3)(b); (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-532(3)(a): (3)(b); (2) Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-532(3)(a)(i): comply with a site plan review or other review process before installing water wise landscaping;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-532(3)(a)(ii): maintain plant material in a healthy condition; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-532(3)(a)(iii): follow specific water wise landscaping design requirements adopted by the county, including a requirement that:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-532(3)(a)(iii)(A): restricts or clarifies the use of mulches considered detrimental to county operations;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-532(3)(a)(iii)(B): imposes minimum or maximum vegetative coverage standards; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-532(3)(a)(iii)(C): restricts or prohibits the use of specific plant materials.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-532(3)(b): A county may not require a property owner to install or keep in place lawn or turf in an area with a width less than eight feet.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-532(4): 73-10-37 A county shall report to the Division of Water Resources the existence, enactment, or modification of an ordinance, resolution, or policy that implements regional-based water use efficiency standards established by the Division of Water Resources by rule under Section

Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-532(1)(d)(ii): "Vegetative coverage" does not mean the ground level surface area covered by the exposed leaf area of a tree or trees.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-532(1)(e): "Water wise landscaping" means any or all of the following:

Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-532(3):

Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-532(3)(a)(i): comply with a site plan review or other review process before installing water wise landscaping;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-532(3)(a)(ii): maintain plant material in a healthy condition; and

Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-533 Land use compatibility with military use.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-533(1): As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-533(1)(a): "Department" means the Department of Veterans and Military Affairs.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-533(1)(b): "Military" means a branch of the armed forces of the United States, including the Utah National Guard.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-533(1)(c): "Military land" means the following land or facilities:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-533(1)(c)(i): Camp Williams;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-533(1)(c)(ii): Hill Air Force Base;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-533(1)(c)(iii): Dugway Proving Ground;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-533(1)(c)(iv): Tooele Army Depot;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-533(1)(c)(v): Utah Test and Training Range;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-533(1)(c)(vi): Nephi Readiness Center;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-533(1)(c)(vii): Cedar City Alternate Flight Facility; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-533(1)(c)(viii): Little Mountain Test Facility.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-533(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-533(2)(a): Except as provided in Subsection (2)(b), on or before July 1, 2025, for any area in a county within 5,000 feet of a boundary of military land, a county shall, in consultation with the department, develop and maintain a compatible use plan to ensure permitted uses and conditional uses relevant to the military land are compatible with the military operations on military land.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-533(2)(b): A county that has a compatible use plan as of January 1, 2023, is not required to develop a new compatible use plan.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-533(3): If a county receives a land use application related to land within 5,000 feet of a boundary of military land, before the county may approve the land use application, the county shall notify the department in writing.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-533(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-533(4)(a): If the department receives the notice described in Subsection (3), the executive director of the department shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-533(4)(a)(i): determine whether the proposed land use is compatible with the military use of the relevant military land; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-533(4)(a)(ii): within 90 days after the receipt of the notice described in Subsection (3), respond in writing to the county regarding the determination of compatibility described in Subsection (4)(a)(i).
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-533(4)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-533(4)(b)(i): For a land use application pertaining to a parcel within 5,000 feet of military land that may have an adverse effect on the operations of the military installation, except as provided in Subsection (4)(b)(ii), the county shall consider the compatible use plan in processing the land use application.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-533(4)(b)(ii): For a land use application pertaining to a parcel within 5,000 feet of military land that may have an adverse effect on the operations of the military installation, if the applicant has a vested right, the county is not required to consider the compatible land use plan in consideration of the land use application.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-533(5): If the department receives the notice described in Subsection (3) before the county has completed the compatible use plan as described in this section, the department shall consult with the county and representatives of the relevant military land to determine whether the use proposed in the land use application is a compatible use.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-534 Residential rear setback limitations.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-534(1): As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-534(1)(a): "Allowable feature" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-534(1)(a)(i): a landing or walkout porch that:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-534(1)(a)(i)(A): is no more than 32 square feet in size; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-534(1)(a)(i)(B): is used for ingress to and egress from the rear of the residential dwelling; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-534(1)(a)(ii): a window well.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-534(1)(b): "Landing" means an uncovered, above-ground platform, with or without stairs, connected to the rear of a residential dwelling.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-534(1)(c): "Setback" means the required distance between the property line of a lot or parcel and the location where a structure is allowed to be placed under an adopted land use regulation.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-534(1)(d): "Walkout porch" means an uncovered platform that is on the ground and connected to the rear of a residential dwelling.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-534(1)(e): "Window well" means a recess in the ground around a residential dwelling to allow for ingress and egress through a window installed in a basement that is fully or partially below ground.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-534(2): A county may not enact or enforce an ordinance, resolution, or policy that prohibits or has the effect of prohibiting an allowable feature within the rear setback of a residential building lot or parcel.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-534(3): Subsection (2) does not apply to a historic district located within the unincorporated area of a county.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-535 Operation of a tower crane.
------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-535(1): 10-9a-539; 10-9a-539; 10-9a-539; 10-9a-539; 10-9a-539 As used in this section:

Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-535(1)(c): 10-9a-539 "Live load" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-535(1)(d): 10-9a-539 "Permit period" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-535(1)(e): 10-9a-539 "Tower crane" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-535(2): Except as provided in Subsection (3), a county may not require airspace approval as a condition for the county's:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-535(2)(a): approval of a building permit; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-535(2)(b): authorization of a development activity.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-535(3): A county may require airspace approval relating to affected land as a condition for the county's approval of a building permit or for the county's authorization of a development activity if:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-535(3)(a): the tower crane will, during the permit period or development activity, carry a live load over the affected land; or

Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-601 Enactment of subdivision ordinance.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-601(1): The legislative body of a county may enact ordinances requiring that a subdivision plat comply with the provisions of the county's ordinances and this part before:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-601(1)(a): the subdivision plat may be filed and recorded in the county recorder's office; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-601(1)(b): lots may be sold.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-601(2): If the legislative body fails to enact a subdivision ordinance, the county may regulate subdivisions only as provided in this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-601(3): The joining of a lot or lots to a parcel does not constitute a subdivision as to the parcel or subject the parcel to the county's subdivision ordinance.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-601(4): A legislative body may adopt a land use regulation that specifies that combining lots does not require a subdivision plat amendment.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-602(2)(a): (1) A legislative body may adopt, modify, revise, or reject an ordinance described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-602(2)(b): A legislative body may consider a planning commission's failure to make a timely recommendation as a negative recommendation if the legislative body has provided for that consideration by ordinance.
