Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1201 Definitions.
----------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1201(1): "Affordable housing" means housing offered for sale at 80% or less of the median county home price for housing of that type.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1201(2): 17C-1-102 "Agency" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1201(3): "Base taxable value" means a property's taxable value as shown upon the assessment roll last equalized during the base year.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1201(4): "Base year" means, for a proposed home ownership promotion zone area, a year beginning the first day of the calendar quarter determined by the last equalized tax roll before the adoption of the home ownership promotion zone.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1201(5): "Home ownership promotion zone" means a home ownership promotion zone created pursuant to this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1201(6): 17C-1-102 "Participant" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1201(7): 17C-1-102 "Participation agreement" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1201(8): 11-36a-102 "Project improvements" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1201(9): 11-36a-102 "System improvements" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1201(10): 59-1-201 "Tax commission" means the State Tax Commission created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1201(11): 59-2-924; 59-2-924; 59-2-1602; 59-2-1602
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1201(11)(a): 59-2-924; 59-2-924 "Tax increment" means the difference between:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1201(11)(a)(i): 59-2-924 the amount of property tax revenue generated each tax year by a taxing entity from the area within a home ownership promotion zone, using the current assessed value and each taxing entity's current certified tax rate as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1201(11)(a)(ii): 59-2-924 the amount of property tax revenue that would be generated from that same area using the base taxable value and each taxing entity's current certified tax rate as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1201(11)(b): 59-2-1602; 59-2-1602 "Tax increment" does not include property revenue from:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1201(11)(b)(i): 59-2-1602 a multicounty assessing and collecting levy described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1201(11)(b)(ii): 59-2-1602 a county additional property tax described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1201(12): 17C-1-102 "Taxing entity" means the same as that term is defined in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1202 County designation of a home ownership promotion zone.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1202(1): 17-27a-1203; 17-27a-1204 Subject to Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1202(2): A home ownership promotion zone created under this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1202(2)(a): is an area of 10 contiguous unincorporated acres or less located entirely within the boundaries of the county, zoned for fewer than six housing units per acre before the creation of the home ownership promotion zone;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1202(2)(b): shall be re-zoned for at least six housing units per acre; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1202(2)(c): may not be encumbered by any residential building permits as of the day on which the home ownership promotion zone is created.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1202(3): 17-27a-1204; 17-27a-1203
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1202(3)(a): 17-27a-1204 The county shall designate the home ownership promotion zone by resolution of the legislative body of the county following:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1202(3)(a)(i): the recommendation of the county planning commission; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1202(3)(a)(ii): 17-27a-1204 the notification requirements described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1202(3)(b): 17-27a-1203 The resolution described in Subsection (3)(a) shall describe how the home ownership promotion zone created pursuant to this section meets the objectives and requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1202(3)(c): The home ownership promotion zone is created on the effective date of the resolution described in Subsection (3)(a).
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1202(4): If a home ownership promotion zone is created as described in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1202(4)(a): affected local taxing entities are required to participate according to the requirements of the home ownership promotion zone established by the county; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1202(4)(b): each affected taxing entity is required to participate at the same rate.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1202(5): A home ownership promotion zone may be modified by the same manner it is created as described in Subsection (3).
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1202(6): 63A-16-505 Within 30 days after the day on which the county creates the home ownership promotion zone as described in Subsection (3), the county shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1202(6)(a): record with the recorder a document containing:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1202(6)(a)(i): a description of the land within the home ownership promotion zone; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1202(6)(a)(ii): the date of creation of the home ownership promotion zone;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1202(6)(b): 63A-16-505 transmit a copy of the description of the land within the home ownership promotion zone and an accurate map or plat indicating the boundaries of the home ownership promotion zone to the Utah Geospatial Resource Center created under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1202(6)(c): transmit a map and description of the land within the home ownership promotion zone to:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1202(6)(c)(i): the auditor, recorder, attorney, surveyor, and assessor of the county in which any part of the home ownership promotion zone is located;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1202(6)(c)(ii): the officer or officers performing the function of auditor or assessor for each taxing entity that does not use the county assessment roll or collect the taxing entity's taxes through the county;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1202(6)(c)(iii): the legislative body or governing board of each taxing entity impacted by the home ownership promotion zone;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1202(6)(c)(iv): the tax commission; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1202(6)(c)(v): the State Board of Education.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1202(7): 17-27a-1205 A county may receive tax increment and use home ownership promotion zone funds as described in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1203 Applicability, requirements, and limitations.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1203(1): A home ownership promotion zone shall promote the following objectives:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1203(1)(a): increasing availability of housing, including affordable housing;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1203(1)(b): promotion of home ownership;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1203(1)(c): overcoming development impediments and market conditions that render an affordable housing development cost prohibitive absent the incentives resulting from a home ownership promotion zone; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1203(1)(d): conservation of water resources through efficient land use.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1203(2): In order to accomplish the objectives described in Subsection (1), a county shall ensure that:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1203(2)(a): land inside the proposed home ownership promotion zone is zoned as residential, with at least six planned housing units per acre;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1203(2)(b): at least 60% of the proposed housing units within the home ownership promotion zone are affordable housing units; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1203(2)(c): all of the proposed housing units within the home ownership promotion zone are deed restricted to require owner occupation for at least five years.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1203(3): A county may restrict short term rentals in a home ownership promotion zone.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1203(4): 17C-1-102; 17C-1-702 A county may not create a home ownership promotion zone if:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1203(4)(a): the proposed home ownership promotion zone would overlap with a school district and:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1203(4)(a)(i): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1203(4)(a)(i)(A): the school district has more than one municipality within the school district's boundaries; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1203(4)(a)(i)(B): the school district already has 100 acres designated as home ownership promotion zone within the school district's boundaries; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1203(4)(a)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1203(4)(a)(ii)(A): the school district has one municipality within the school district's boundaries; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1203(4)(a)(ii)(B): the school district already has 50 acres designated as home ownership promotion zone within the school district's boundaries; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1203(4)(b): 17C-1-102; 17C-1-702 the area in the proposed home ownership promotion zone would overlap with:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1203(4)(b)(i): 17C-1-102; 17C-1-702 a project area, as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1203(4)(b)(ii): an existing housing and transit reinvestment zone.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1204 Notification prior to creation of a home ownership promotion zone.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1204(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1204(1)(a): As used in this section, "hearing" means a public meeting in which the legislative body of a county:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1204(1)(a)(i): considers a resolution creating a home ownership promotion zone; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1204(1)(a)(ii): takes public comment on a proposed home ownership promotion zone.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1204(1)(b): A hearing under this section may be combined with any other public meeting of a legislative body of a county.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1204(2): 17-27a-1002 Before a county creates a home ownership promotion zone as described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1204(3): 63G-30-102 The notice required by Subsection (2) shall be given by:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1204(3)(a): 63G-30-102 publishing notice for the county, as a class A notice under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1204(3)(b): at least 30 days before the hearing, mailing notice to:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1204(3)(b)(i): each record owner of property located within the proposed home ownership promotion zone;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1204(3)(b)(ii): the State Tax Commission; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1204(3)(b)(iii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1204(3)(b)(iii)(A): if the proposed home ownership promotion zone is subject to a taxing entity committee, each member of the taxing entity committee and the State Board of Education; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1204(3)(b)(iii)(B): if the proposed home ownership promotion zone is not subject to a taxing entity committee, the legislative body or governing board of each taxing entity within the boundaries of the proposed home ownership promotion zone.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1204(4): The mailing of the notice to record property owners required under Subsection (3)(b) shall be conclusively considered to have been properly completed if:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1204(4)(a): the county mails the notice to the property owners as shown in the records, including an electronic database, of the county recorder's office and at the addresses shown in those records; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1204(4)(b): the county recorder's office records used by the agency in identifying owners to whom the notice is mailed and their addresses were obtained or accessed from the county recorder's office no earlier than 30 days before the mailing.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1204(5): The county shall include in each notice required under this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1204(5)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1204(5)(a)(i): a boundary description of the proposed home ownership promotion zone; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1204(5)(a)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1204(5)(a)(ii)(A): a mailing address or telephone number where a person may request that a copy of the boundary description of the proposed home ownership promotion zone be sent at no cost to the person by mail, email, or facsimile transmission; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1204(5)(a)(ii)(B): if the agency or community has an Internet website, an Internet address where a person may gain access to an electronic, printable copy of the boundary description of the proposed home ownership promotion zone;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1204(5)(b): a map of the boundaries of the proposed home ownership promotion zone;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1204(5)(c): an explanation of the purpose of the hearing; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1204(5)(d): a statement of the date, time, and location of the hearing.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1204(6): The county shall include in each notice under Subsection (3)(b):
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1204(6)(a): a statement that property tax revenue resulting from an increase in valuation of property within the proposed home ownership promotion zone will be paid to the county for proposed home ownership promotion zone development rather than to the taxing entity to which the tax revenue would otherwise have been paid; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1204(6)(b): an invitation to the recipient of the notice to submit to the county comments concerning the subject matter of the hearing before the date of the hearing.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1204(7): A county may include in a notice under Subsection (2) any other information the county considers necessary or advisable, including the public purpose achieved by the proposed home ownership promotion zone.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1205 Payment, use, and administration of revenue from a home ownership promotion zone.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1205(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1205(1)(a): A county may receive tax increment and use home ownership promotion zone funds in accordance with this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1205(1)(b): The maximum amount of time that a county may receive and use tax increment pursuant to a home ownership promotion zone is 15 consecutive years.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1205(2): 59-2-1365 A county that collects property tax on property located within a home ownership promotion zone shall, in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1205(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1205(3)(a): Tax increment retained by a county in accordance with Subsection (2) is not revenue of the taxing entity or county, but home ownership promotion zone funds.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1205(3)(b): Home ownership promotion zone funds may be administered by an agency created by the county within which the home ownership promotion zone is located.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1205(3)(c): Before an agency may receive home ownership promotion zone funds from a county, the agency shall enter into an interlocal agreement with the county.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1205(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1205(4)(a): A county or agency shall use home ownership promotion zone funds within, or for the direct benefit of, the home ownership promotion zone.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1205(4)(b): If any home ownership promotion zone funds will be used outside of the home ownership promotion zone, the legislative body of the county shall make a finding that the use of the home ownership promotion zone funds outside of the home ownership promotion zone will directly benefit the home ownership promotion zone.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1205(5): 17-27a-1203 A county or agency shall use home ownership promotion zone funds to achieve the purposes described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1205(5)(a): project improvement costs;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1205(5)(b): systems improvement costs; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1205(5)(c): the costs of the county to create and administer the home ownership promotion zone, which may not exceed 3% of the total home ownership promotion zone funds.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1205(6): Home ownership promotion zone funds may be paid to a participant, if the county and participant enter into a participation agreement which requires the participant to utilize the home ownership promotion zone funds as allowed in this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1205(7): Home ownership promotion zone funds may be used to pay all of the costs of bonds issued by the county in accordance with Title 17C, Chapter 1, Part 5, Agency Bonds, including the cost to issue and repay the bonds including interest.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1205(8): A county may:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1205(8)(a): create one or more public infrastructure districts within home ownership promotion zone under Title 17D, Chapter 4, Public Infrastructure District Act; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-27a-1205(8)(b): pledge and utilize the home ownership promotion zone funds to guarantee the payment of public infrastructure bonds issued by a public infrastructure district.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 17 - Chapter 28 - Firemen's Civil Service Commission
********************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-1 County Fire Civil Service Council.
----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-1(1): There is created in each of the counties of this state having and maintaining a regularly organized fire department in which there are regularly employed four or more paid firefighters, a County Fire Civil Service Council consisting of three members to be appointed by the county executive.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-1(2): Each member shall serve for a term of three years except that the county executive shall appoint the original council members as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-1(2)(a): one member for a period of one year;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-1(2)(b): one member for a period of two years; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-1(2)(c): one member for a period of three years.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-2 Vacancies -- Compensation -- Removal from office.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-2(1): Any vacancy occurring on the County Fire Civil Service Council shall be filled by appointment by the county executive for the unexpired term.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-2(2): Not more than two members of any council shall at any one time be affiliated with or a member of the same political party.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-2(3): A member of the council may not hold, during the term of his office, any other public office or be a candidate for any other public office.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-2(4): Each council member shall receive $50 for each meeting of the council attended by him.  The county legislative body may raise the compensation of council members as it considers appropriate.  This compensation and allowance shall be a charge against the county and paid monthly.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-2(5): In case of misconduct, willful neglect, or inability to perform the duties of his office, any council member may be removed from office by the  county legislative body upon a majority vote of the body, but the member is entitled to an opportunity to be heard in his own defense.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-2.4 County Fire Civil Service System rules and policies.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-2.4(1): The executive director shall recommend rules and policies for the County Fire Civil Service System, which shall be subject to approval by the county legislative body.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-2.4(2): The County Fire Civil Service System rules shall provide for recruiting activities, including the recruiting of minorities and women, job-related minimum requirements, selection procedures, certification procedures, appointments, probationary periods, promotion, position classification, recordkeeping, reductions in force, grievances and complaints, disciplinary action, work hours, holidays, and other necessary and proper requirements not inconsistent with this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-2.4(3): The executive director shall publish or cause to be published these rules and policies in a manual form, to be updated regularly and made available to fire department employees.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-2.6 Merit principles.
-------------------------------------------------
The County Fire Civil Service System shall be established and administered in a manner that will provide for the effective implementation of the following merit principles:Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-2.6(1): recruiting, selecting, and advancing employees on the basis of their relative ability, knowledge, and skills, including open consideration of qualified applicants for initial appointment;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-2.6(2): provision of equitable and adequate job classification and compensation systems, including pay and benefits programs;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-2.6(3): training of employees as needed to assure high-quality performance;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-2.6(4): retention of employees on the basis of the adequacy of their performance and separation of employees whose inadequate performance cannot be corrected;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-2.6(5): fair treatment of applicants and employees in all aspects of personal administration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, political affiliation, age, or disability, and with proper regard for their privacy and constitutional rights as citizens;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-2.6(6): provision of information to employees regarding their political rights and prohibited practices under the Hatch Act; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-2.6(7): provision of a formal procedure for processing the appeals and grievances of employees without discrimination, coercion, restraint, or reprisal.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-3 Organization of council -- Accommodations.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-3(1): The County Fire Civil Service Council shall select one of its members as chair.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-3(2): The county executive shall assign a qualified employee of the county to act as secretary to the council and a qualified attorney to act as legal counsel to the council, each of which shall be acceptable to the council and shall act and serve without additional compensation.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-3(3): The county executive shall provide suitable accommodations, equipment, and necessary funds to enable the council of its county to properly conduct its business.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-4 Duties of secretary.
--------------------------------------------------
The secretary of the County Fire Civil Service Council shall keep a record of all its meetings, work, and official acts, and shall perform other service as required by the council.  The secretary shall have custody of the council's books and records.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-5 Appointment of county fire department personnel -- Volunteers.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-5(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-5(1)(a): Except for the chief and deputy chief of a county fire department, all firefighter positions in county fire departments shall be filled by persons appointed from a certified county fire civil service register.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-5(1)(b): County fire civil service registers for employment and promotion shall be prepared by the County Fire Civil Service executive director according to the requirements of this chapter and civil service rules.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-5(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-5(2)(a): The chief and the deputy chief of any county fire department may be appointed from either the certified county fire civil service register or from qualified applicants outside of the county civil service system.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-5(2)(b): The positions of chief and deputy chief are exempt from civil service status.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-5(2)(c): A chief or deputy chief who is appointed from the certified county fire civil service register shall be returned to the civil service status that he held before his appointment after his appointment expires or terminates.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-5(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-5(3)(a): All persons employed as firefighters, emergency medical technicians, or a combination of firefighter and emergency medical technician, shall be subject to the provisions of this chapter and shall be members of the County Fire Civil Service System.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-5(3)(b): Other fire department employees who do not provide firefighter services are not considered subject to this chapter and shall be covered by the countywide merit system.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-5(4): (4)(b)(ii); (4)(b)(i); (4)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-5(4)(a): A volunteer firefighter or paid-call firefighter is not subject to this chapter and is not a merit employee subject to the County Fire Civil Service System.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-5(4)(b): (4)(b)(ii); (4)(b)(i); (4)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-5(4)(b)(i): (4)(b)(ii) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-5(4)(b)(ii): (4)(b)(i) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-5(4)(b)(iii): (4)(b) For purposes of this Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-6 County Fire Civil Service executive director -- Powers and duties.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-6(1): Title 17, Chapter 33, County Personnel Management Act
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-6(1)(a): Within each county subject to this chapter, there is created the office of executive director of County Fire Civil Service, who shall be appointed by the county executive.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-6(1)(b): The executive director shall be a person with proven experience in personnel management and shall be accountable to the county executive for his performance in office.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-6(1)(c): Title 17, Chapter 33, County Personnel Management Act The position of executive director shall be a merit position under
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-6(2): The County Fire Civil Service executive director shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-6(2)(a): exercise, on behalf of the county, executive or administrative duties regarding the management and administration of the County Fire Civil Service System, including the management and administration of examinations, classification of duties, preparation of hiring registers, recommendations regarding civil service regulations and policies, and other duties provided in this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-6(2)(b): classify persons successfully passing examinations in the order of their ascertained merit and prepare a list of them;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-6(2)(c): make certification of classifications when required;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-6(2)(d): make, publish, and distribute necessary rules relative to examinations, classifications, and certifications as may be proper and desirable in the administration of this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-6(2)(e): establish and maintain records of employees in the County Fire Civil Service System setting forth as to each employee class, title, pay, status, and other relevant data;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-6(2)(f): make necessary and proper reports to the County Fire Civil Service Council, the fire chief, or the county executive;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-6(2)(g): apply and carry out the provisions of this chapter and the policies and rules adopted under it; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-6(2)(h): perform other lawful acts that may be necessary or desirable to carry out the purposes of this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-6(3): The executive director shall appoint the members of and act as chair to a County Fire Civil Service Advisory Committee which shall assist the executive director in making recommendations to the county executive regarding County Fire Civil Service System rules and policies.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-7 Examinations.
-------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-7(1): A person may not be appointed to any civil service position as a firefighter in any fire department subject to the provisions of this chapter until he has successfully passed an examination and been certified as eligible for consideration by the County Fire Civil Service executive director, except that any honorably discharged veteran of the United States military service shall receive preferential employment consideration for entry into the County Fire Civil Service System.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-7(2): All examinations shall be public, competitive, and free and fairly test the ability of persons to discharge the duties of the position.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-8 Eligible appointees to fire department.
---------------------------------------------------------------------
The fire chief of each fire department of counties subject to the provisions of this chapter shall, subject to the rules of the County Fire Civil Service Council, appoint from the certified county fire civil service register, all persons necessary to fill all firefighter civil service positions in the county fire department.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-9 Certification of eligible appointees -- Probationary period.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-9(1): The fire chief of each county fire department shall notify the County Fire Civil Service executive director of all positions to be filled in his department when the need arises.  The County Fire Civil Service executive director shall then, as soon as possible, certify from the certified county fire civil service register to the head of the fire department the appropriate number of persons, consistent with adopted rules.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-9(2): Appointments from the certified register shall be placed on probation under conditions and for a period as prescribed by County Fire Civil Service Council rules.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-10 Vacancies in civil service positions.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
Any vacancy occurring in any county fire civil service position in any county fire department subject to this chapter shall be filled by an employee of the department having a lesser, equal, or superior position than that in which the vacancy occurs if that employee submits himself to examination for the position, is found qualified, and is certified by the County Fire Civil Service executive director as provided in this chapter.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-11 Temporary work -- Term or period.
----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-11(1): (2) Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-11(2): (1) An appointment described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-12 Removal from office and disciplinary action -- Appeals -- Hearing and determination -- Findings.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-12(1): Any person holding a position under this chapter may be removed from office or employment, reduced in rank or grade, or otherwise disciplined by the fire chief for misconduct, incompetency, failure to perform the duties of his employment or to properly observe the rules of the office or department in which he is employed, or for other cause, as set out in County Fire Civil Service Council rules.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-12(2): Any such disciplinary action is subject to appeal in all cases by the aggrieved party to the County Fire Civil Service Council in the manner established by rule. After an appeal is filed the council shall, as soon as practicable, hear and determine the matter.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-12(3): If it determines that it is in the best interest of the county, the county legislative body may appoint an administrative law judge, trained and experienced in personnel matters, to initially hear the matter. Upon hearing, the administrative law judge shall make findings of fact and a recommendation to the council. The council may adopt or reject the recommendation of the administrative law judge or request that the judge hold further factual hearings prior to the council's decision.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-12(4): The council may then affirm, modify, vacate, or set aside the order for disciplinary action.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-12(5): The aggrieved party shall, upon demand, be granted a public hearing, at which he may appear in person or by counsel or both.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-12(6): After the hearing, the findings and determination of the County Fire Civil Service Council shall be certified to the head of the county fire department from whose order the appeal is taken. Notice in writing of the determination shall be served upon the person affected.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-12(7): The council determination shall be enforced and followed by the head of the fire department until an appeal is taken to the district court by any affected person.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-13 Appeal to district court.
--------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-13(1): Any person aggrieved by a determination of the County Fire Civil Service Council may, within 30 days after notice of the council's ruling, institute an action in the district court of the county or in the county of the aggrieved person's residence, against the County Fire Civil Service Council in its official capacity, setting out his grievance and his right to complain.  In its answer, the council may set out any matter in justification.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-13(2): The court shall determine the issues of both questions of law and fact and may affirm, set aside, or modify the council ruling.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-28-14 Reports by executive director.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Each County Fire Civil Service executive director shall, each December, make an annual report to the county executive and the county legislative body and shall make other reports as required by the county executive regarding the activities of the County Fire Civil Service Council and System.

Utah Code Annotated - Title 17 - Chapter 30 - Deputy Sheriffs - Merit System
****************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-1 Definitions.
------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-1(1): "Governing body" means the county  legislative body.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-1(2): "Appointing authority" means the sheriff of a county having jurisdiction over any peace officer.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-1(3): "Peace officer" means any paid deputy sheriff, other than a chief deputy designated by the sheriff, who is in the continuous employ of a county.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-1(4): 17-30-3 "Commission" means the merit system commission consisting of three persons appointed as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-1(5): 53-1-103 "Department of Public Safety" means the department created in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-2 Application -- Subordinate officers in sheriff's office to be appointed from list -- Officers serving on effective date considered qualified.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-2(1): 11-13-103 This chapter does not apply to a county of the first class or an interlocal entity, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-2(2): From and after the effective date of this act the sheriff of each county with a population of 20,000 people or more which shall regularly employ one or more peace officers shall, by and with the advice and consent of the county legislative body, and subject to the rules and regulations of the merit service commission, appoint from the classified merit service list furnished by the merit service commission, all subordinate peace officers in his department and in like manner fill all vacancies in the same and shall further promote, transfer, demote, suspend or remove peace officers in accordance with the provisions of this act.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-2(3): Every peace officer who is serving as such upon the effective date of this act is considered fully qualified for such position without examination or test and is considered to have been appointed and to hold his position and classification pursuant to the provisions of this act.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-2(4): Counties with a population of less than 20,000 people may implement a deputy sheriff's merit system if approved by the county legislative body or the people of the county through referendum or initiative.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-3 Establishment of merit system commission -- Appointment, qualifications, and compensation of members.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-3(1): (1)(b); (1)(b); 11-13-103; Title 11, Chapter 13, Interlocal Cooperation Act; 17B-1-102; 17B-1-203
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-3(1)(a): (1)(b) Each county with a population of 20,000 or more shall establish a merit system commission consisting of three members appointed as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-3(1)(b): (1)(b); 11-13-103; Title 11, Chapter 13, Interlocal Cooperation Act; 17B-1-102; 17B-1-203

Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-3(1)(b)(i)(A): 11-13-103; Title 11, Chapter 13, Interlocal Cooperation Act "Police interlocal entity" means an interlocal entity, as defined in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-3(1)(b)(iv): For each other county, all three members shall be appointed by the county legislative body.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-3(1)(c): Not more than two members of the commission shall be affiliated with or members of the same political party.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-3(1)(d): Of the original appointees, one member shall be appointed for a term ending February 1 of the first odd-numbered year after the date of appointment, and one each for terms ending two and four years thereafter.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-3(1)(e): Upon the expiration of any of the terms, a successor shall be appointed for a full term of six years.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-3(1)(f): Appointment to fill a vacancy resulting other than from expiration of term shall be for the unexpired portion of the term only.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-3(2): Members of a commission shall be citizens of the state, shall have been residents of the area embraced by the governmental unit from which appointed not less than five years next preceding the date of appointment, and shall hold no other office or employment under the governmental unit for which appointed.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-3(3): The county legislative body may compensate a member for service on the commission and reimburse the member for necessary expenses incurred in the performance of the member's duties.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-4 General duty of commission.
---------------------------------------------------------
The commission shall be responsible for carrying out the provisions of this act, and shall make all necessary rules and regulations, not in conflict with the provisions hereof, as may be necessary for that purpose.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-5 Organization of commission -- Secretary -- Offices -- Job classification plan.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Each merit system commission shall be organized by its members who shall select one member as chairman and shall have assigned to it by the county legislative body, a qualified employee of the county to act as secretary. Such employee shall be acceptable to the commission and shall act and serve as secretary without additional compensation unless the county legislative body so specifies. The county legislative body shall provide suitable accommodations, supplies and equipment as needed to enable the commission to attend to its business. The commission shall formulate a comprehensive job classification plan covering all peace officers of the governmental unit. The plan shall place all positions requiring substantially the same duties and qualifications in the same classification and shall include minimum physical and educational qualifications of the applicants for each position, and provide standards for promotion. The commission shall adopt a classification plan which shall be the basis of the administration of this act until changed with the approval of the commission. In the event a new position is created and approved by the governing body, such position shall automatically be classified and become a part of the classification plan.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-6 Examinations -- How prepared, conducted, and graded -- Notice of examination.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-6(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-6(1)(a): When necessary, the commission shall give competitive examinations to determine the qualification of applicants for positions as peace officers.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-6(1)(b): The examinations shall be practical in character and shall relate to matters that will fairly test the mental and physical ability and knowledge of the applicants to discharge the duties of the positions.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-6(1)(c): The examinations shall be prepared, conducted, and graded under the direction of the commission, or by impartial special examiners if the commission finds it necessary.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-6(2): 45-1-101
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-6(2)(a): 45-1-101 Notice of examination shall be:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-6(2)(a)(i): 45-1-101
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-6(2)(a)(i)(A): published one time not less than 15 days before the examination in a newspaper of general circulation in the area concerned; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-6(2)(a)(i)(B): 45-1-101 published, in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-6(2)(a)(ii): posted in a conspicuous place in the office of the department concerned.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-6(2)(b): The notice shall set forth minimum and maximum wages, physical and educational requirements, and passing grades, which shall be not less than 70%.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-6(2)(c): A person completing an examination shall be promptly notified by mail at his last known address of his final grade.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-7 Disqualification of applicant for examination -- Appeal to commission.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-7(1): The commission shall disqualify an applicant for examination who:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-7(1)(a): does not meet advertised qualifications;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-7(1)(b): has been convicted of a criminal offense inimical to the public service, or involving moral turpitude;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-7(1)(c): has practiced or attempted deception or fraud in the applicant's application or examination, or in securing eligibility for appointment; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-7(1)(d): is not:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-7(1)(d)(i): a citizen of the United States; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-7(1)(d)(ii): a lawful permanent resident of the United States who:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-7(1)(d)(ii)(A): has been in the United States legally for the five years immediately before the day on which the application is made; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-7(1)(d)(ii)(B): has legal authorization to work in the United States.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-7(2): If an applicant is rejected, the applicant shall be notified by mail at the applicant's last known address.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-7(3): At any time before the day on which the examination is held, an applicant may correct a defect in the applicant's application, or appeal in writing to the commission.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-8 Preservation and inspection of examination papers.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
All examination papers shall remain the property of the commission, and shall be preserved until the expiration of the eligible register for the preparation of which an examination is given.  Examination papers are not open to public inspection without court order, but an applicant may inspect the applicant's own papers at any time within 30 days after the mailing of notice of the applicant's grade.  The appointing authority may inspect the papers of any eligible applicant certified for appointment.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-9 Preparation and expiration of eligible register.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-9(1): Upon completion of an examination the commission shall prepare an eligible register containing the names of all persons receiving a passing grade in the order of grades earned, beginning with the highest.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-9(2): An eligible register shall expire not later than two years after the date of the examination unless the commission, for good reason, shall extend the time not to exceed one additional year. The promulgation of a new eligible register shall automatically cancel all previous registers for the same class or position.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-10 Appointments from eligible register -- Failure to accept appointment.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-10(1): When a peace officer is to be appointed, the appointing authority shall request the merit system commission to certify three eligible applicants for the position. The commission shall thereupon certify to the appointing authority the names of the three applicants standing highest on the eligible register. The appointing authority shall select and appoint one of the persons so certified.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-10(2): In the event a certified person fails to accept a proffered appointment, the certified person may, at the certified person's request, retain the certified person's place on the eligible register if the certified person submits in writing reasons sufficient in the judgment of the commission to justify such failure.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-11 Probationary period of appointment.
------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-11(1): 17-30-10 Any peace officer appointed under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-11(2): (1); Title 53, Chapter 6, Peace Officer Standards and Training Act The probationary period shall be extended beyond the 12 months under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-11(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-11(3)(a): Continuance in the position after the expiration of the probationary period constitutes a permanent appointment.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-11(3)(b): Service under a temporary or emergency appointment is not considered as part of the probationary period.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-11(4): A person removed during the probationary period may not be placed on the eligible register again without having passed another regular examination.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-12 Vacancies -- Positions requiring special qualifications -- Competition suspended -- Promotion -- Promotional register.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-12(1): In case of vacancy in a position requiring peculiar and exceptional qualifications of a scientific, professional or expert character, upon satisfactory evidence that competition is impracticable and that the position can best be filled by the selection of some designated person of recognized attainments the board may, after public hearing and by the affirmative vote of all members suspend competition, and all such cases of suspension shall be reported together with the reason therefor, in the annual reports of the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-12(2): Vacancies occurring in the merit system classification of any county shall be filled by promotion insofar as possible.  A promotion shall be made only after an open competitive examination, admission to which shall be limited to merit system officers.  Such examination shall include an average of service ratings for the next preceding year, a rating of seniority, and test the competence of the peace officer to perform the duties required in the position for which application is made.  The combined weights of service rating and seniority shall be not more than 40% of the whole examination.  Succeeding vacancies shall also be filled by promotion until the lowest grade is reached, which grade shall then be filled from the eligible list as herein set forth.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-12(3): After a promotional examination, the commission shall prepare a promotional register which shall take precedence over an eligible register. Certification therefrom shall be made in the same manner as from an eligible register.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-13 Transfer of officer.
---------------------------------------------------
A merit system officer may be transferred, without examination, from one position to a similar position in the same class and grade in the same governmental unit.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-14 Temporary appointment.
-----------------------------------------------------
A temporary appointment for a period not exceeding 60 days may be made, pending examination, when there is no eligible, promotion, or re-employment register in existence.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-15 Emergency appointment.
-----------------------------------------------------
An emergency appointment may be made for a period not exceeding seven days, and with the consent of the commission may be extended one time for an additional period of not to exceed seven days, in the event an eligible person is not immediately available from the eligible, promotion, or re-employment register and the work to be performed is necessary to expedite the public business.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-16 Temporary layoffs -- Re-employment register.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
When necessary because of lack of funds or work an officer may, with the approval of the commission, be temporarily laid off. Such layoff shall be made according to the lowest rating of the officers of the class of position affected, calculated upon seniority under a method prescribed by the commission. A person serving under temporary or emergency appointment shall be laid off before any merit system officer. A merit system officer who is laid off shall be placed upon a re-employment register to be re-employed in the inverse order in which the merit system officer is laid off, which register shall take precedence over all eligible registers.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-17 Leave of absence -- Sick leaves and vacations.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-17(1): The appointing authority, with the approval of the commission, may grant an officer a leave of absence without pay for a period not to exceed one year. In the event an officer on leave takes a higher position in police work which does not come under the merit system provisions of this act, the leave may, with the consent of the commission, be renewed. In the event an officer is elected sheriff, or is appointed chief deputy, the officer shall automatically be placed on leave for the period of time the officer remains sheriff or chief deputy. Upon the termination of a leave of absence, the officer shall be returned to the officer's former position.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-17(2): Sick leaves and vacations with pay shall be as provided by law or ordinance.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-18 Demotion, reduction in pay, suspension or discharge -- Grounds -- How made.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-18(1): A merit system officer holding a permanent appointment may be demoted, reduced in pay, suspended, or discharged for:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-18(1)(a): neglect of duty;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-18(1)(b): disobedience of a reasonable order;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-18(1)(c): misconduct;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-18(1)(d): inefficiency, or inability to satisfactorily perform assigned duties;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-18(1)(e): any act inimical to the public service.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-18(2): No officer shall be suspended for more than 30 days at one time, nor more than 60 days in one year. Demotion, reduction in pay, suspension, or discharge shall be made upon order of the appointing authority.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-19 Disciplinary charges and officer grievances -- Appeal to commission -- Hearing -- Findings.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-19(1): 17-30-18 Each person who orders the demotion, reduction in pay, suspension, or discharge of a merit system officer for any cause set forth in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-19(1)(a): file written charges with the commission; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-19(1)(b): serve the officer with a copy of the written charges.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-19(2)(b): If an officer files a grievance, as defined by the commission, and exhausts all internal grievance procedures, if any, the officer may, within 10 days after receiving notice of the final disposition of the grievance, file an appeal with the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-19(3): (3)(b)(ii); (3)

Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-19(3)(b): (3)(b)(ii); (3)
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-19(3)(b)(i): (3)(b)(ii); (3) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-19(3)(b)(ii): A hearing may be held more than 90 days after an appeal or grievance is filed if:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-19(3)(b)(ii)(A): the officer and employer agree; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-19(3)(b)(ii)(B): for good cause the commission so orders.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-19(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-19(4)(a): If the aggrieved officer so desires, the hearing shall be public.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-19(4)(b): The parties may be represented by counsel at the hearing.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-19(5): After the hearing the commission shall make its decision in writing, including findings of fact, and shall mail a copy to each party.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-20 Appeal to district court -- Scope of review.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
A person aggrieved by an act or failure to act of any merit system commission under this act may appeal to the district court, if the aggrieved person has exhausted the remedies of appeal to the commission. The courts may review questions of law and fact and may affirm, set aside, or modify the ruling complained of.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-21 Power of commission members to administer oaths and subpoena witnesses -- Rights of, and fees for, witnesses.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-21(1): Any member of a commission, in performance of his duties as such, shall have power to administer oaths and subpoena witnesses and documents. If a person refuses to [or] fails to obey a subpoena issued by a commissioner, the district court may, upon application of a commissioner, compel obedience as in like cases before the district court.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-21(2): Witnesses in proceedings before a commission shall be subject to all the rights, privileges, duties and penalties of witnesses in courts of record, and shall be paid the same fees, as an expense of the commission.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-22 Prohibitions against political activities -- Penalties.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-22(1): Any employee of a governmental unit or member of a governing body, or appointing authority, or peace officer who shall appoint, promote, transfer, demote, suspend, discharge or change the amount of compensation of any merit system officer or seek, aid or abet the appointment, promotion, transfer, demotion, suspension, discharge or change in the amount of compensation of any merit system officer, or promise or threaten to do so, for giving, withholding, or neglecting to make any contributions or any service for any political purpose, or who solicits, directly or indirectly, any such contribution or service, from a merit system officer, is guilty of a class B misdemeanor.  This section does not apply to political speeches or use of mass communications media for political purposes by persons not merit system officers even though merit system officers may be present or within the reach of such media unless the purpose and intent is to violate this section with direct respect to those officers.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-22(2): No merit system officer may engage in any political activity during the hours of employment, nor shall any person solicit political contributions from merit system officers during hours of employment for political purposes; but nothing in this section shall preclude voluntary contributions by a merit system officer to the party or candidate of the officer's choice.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-23 Severability of provisions -- Duty of commission to provide for unspecified activities.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
If any section or provision of this act is declared unconstitutional or void, the fact of such holding shall in no wise affect those sections and provisions not held unconstitutional or void and which can be retained in effect without the provision declared unconstitutional and void, and it shall be the duty of the merit service commission to provide by rule for the operation and functioning of any activity within the purpose and spirit of the act which may be or may become necessary and proper and which is not specifically provided hereby.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-30-24 More than one chief deputy in larger county departments.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
In counties employing more than 100 full time uniformed peace officers, the appointing authority, with the consent of the merit commission and the county  legislative body, may appoint more than one chief deputy or undersheriff.

Utah Code Annotated - Title 17 - Chapter 30a - Peace Officer Merit System in Counties of the First Class Act
************************************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-101 Title.
---------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-101(1): This chapter is known as "Peace Officer Merit System in Counties of the First Class Act."
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-101(2): This part is known as "General Provisions."


Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-102 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-102(1): "Appointing authority" means the county sheriff or the chief executive officer of a police interlocal entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-102(2): 17-30a-202 "Commission" means the merit system commission consisting of three persons appointed in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-102(3): "Department" means a county sheriff's office or a police interlocal entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-102(4): "Legislative body" means the county legislative body or the governing body of the police interlocal entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-102(5): "Merit system officer" means a peace officer who has merit status as defined in this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-102(6): "Peace officer" means a paid deputy sheriff or law enforcement officer, other than a chief deputy or other exempt appointed officer designated by the appointing authority, who is in the continuous employ of the appointing authority.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-102(7): 11-13-103; Title 11, Chapter 13, Interlocal Cooperation Act "Police interlocal entity" means an interlocal entity, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-102(7)(a): Title 11, Chapter 13, Interlocal Cooperation Act under
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-102(7)(b): to provide law enforcement service to an area that includes the unincorporated part of the county.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-103 Application.
---------------------------------------------
This chapter applies to a county of the first class or a police interlocal entity in which a county of the first class is a party to an interlocal agreement to provide law enforcement service.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-104 Subordinate officers appointed, reappointed -- Officers serving on effective date considered qualified.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-104(1): The appointing authority of a county or police interlocal entity subject to this chapter that regularly employs one or more peace officers shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-104(1)(a): appoint a peace officer with the advice and consent of the county legislative body or police interlocal entity governing body, subject to the rules and regulations of the commission;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-104(1)(b): appoint each subordinate peace officer;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-104(1)(c): fill a vacancy in the department; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-104(1)(d): further promote, transfer, reassign, reappoint, demote, suspend, or remove a peace officer in accordance with the provisions of this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-104(2): The commission shall adopt rules governing the appointment of peace officers through reappointment of a former employee who separated in good standing, within one year after separation.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-104(3): A peace officer appointed before May 13, 2014, is considered to have been appointed to and hold the officer's position and classification pursuant to the provisions of this chapter.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-204(3)(c): The county sheriff or chief executive of the police interlocal entity may, in accordance with the contracting process established by the county or police interlocal entity, contract support services to third parties.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-205 Comprehensive job classification plan.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-205(1): The commission shall formulate a comprehensive job classification plan covering all merit system officers employed by the sheriff or by the police interlocal entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-205(2): The plan shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-205(2)(a): place all positions requiring substantially the same duties and qualifications in the same classification;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-205(2)(b): include minimum physical and educational qualifications of the applicants for each position; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-205(2)(c): provide standards for promotion.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-205(3): In the event a new position is created and approved, the commission shall classify the position in the classification plan.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-206(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-206(2)(a): A witness in a proceeding before the commission is subject to all the rights, privileges, duties, and penalties of witnesses in courts of record.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-206(2)(b): The commission shall pay a witness fee equivalent to those paid for a court of record.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-207 Duty of commission to provide for unspecified activities.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The commission may provide by rule for the operation and functioning of an activity within the purpose and spirit of this chapter if the activity is necessary and proper and not otherwise prohibited by law.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-303 Disqualification of applicant for examination -- Appeal to commission.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-303(1): In accordance with this section and rules adopted by the commission, an applicant may be disqualified if the applicant:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-303(1)(a): does not meet minimum qualifications;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-303(1)(b): has been convicted of a criminal offense inimical to the public service or involving moral turpitude;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-303(1)(c): has practiced or attempted deception or fraud in the application or examination process or in securing eligibility for appointment; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-303(1)(d): is not:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-303(1)(d)(i): a citizen of the United States; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-303(1)(d)(ii): a lawful permanent resident of the United States who:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-303(1)(d)(ii)(A): has been in the United States legally for the five years immediately before the day on which the application is made; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-303(1)(d)(ii)(B): has legal authorization to work in the United States.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-303(2): If an applicant is rejected, the applicant shall be promptly notified.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-303(3): At any time before the day on which the examination is held, an applicant may correct a defect in the applicant's application.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-303(4): An applicant may file a written appeal regarding the application process with the commission at any time before the day on which the examination is held.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-305 Preparation and expiration of eligible appointment register.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-305(1): Upon completion of an examination, the commission shall prepare and adopt an eligible appointment register containing the names of applicants receiving a passing grade ranked in the order of grades earned, beginning with the highest.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-305(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-305(2)(a): An eligible appointment register shall expire not later than two years after the date of the examination unless the commission, for good reason, extends the time not to exceed one additional year.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-305(2)(b): If the commission adopts a new eligible appointment register, a previous appointment register for the same class or position is cancelled.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-306 Appointments from eligible appointment register -- Failure to accept appointment.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-306(1): If the appointment of a peace officer is an appointment based on an examination, the appointing authority shall request that the commission certify eligible applicants for each position.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-306(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-306(2)(a): The commission shall certify, to the appointing authority, a number of names equal to three times the number of allocations being filled.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-306(2)(b): The names of the applicants shall be ranked in order of examination score, beginning with the name of the applicant standing highest on the eligible appointment register.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-306(3): (2)(b) The appointing authority shall select a person described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-306(4): If a certified applicant fails to accept a proffered appointment, the applicant:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-306(4)(a): may request in writing that the applicant be able to retain the applicant's place on the eligible appointment register; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-306(4)(b): shall provide reasons sufficient, in the judgment of the commission, to justify the applicant's failure to accept.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-309 Transfer and reassignment.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-309(1): A merit system officer may be transferred, without examination, from one position to a similar position in the same class and grade within the department.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-309(2): A merit system officer may be voluntarily reassigned, including to another class and grade, in accordance with rules adopted by the commission.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-310 Temporary and part-time appointment.
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-310(1): A department may appoint an employee to a temporary appointment for a period not exceeding 120 days within any 12 month period.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-310(2): A temporary employee is not a merit system officer and may be appointed without examination.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-310(3): A department may appoint an employee to a part-time appointment for a period not to exceed 29 hours per week.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-310(4): A part-time employee is not a merit system officer and may be appointed without examination.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-314 Prohibitions against political activities -- Penalties.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-314(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-314(1)(a): An officer, employee, or member of a governing body of a county or a police interlocal entity, whether elected or appointed, may not directly or indirectly coerce, command, or advise a merit system officer to pay, lend, or contribute part of the officer's salary or compensation or anything else of value to a party, committee, organization, agency, or person for political purpose.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-314(1)(b): A county or police interlocal entity officer, employee, or member of a governing body, whether elected or appointed, may not make or attempt to make a merit system officer's personnel status dependent upon the officer's support or lack of support for a political party, committee, organization, agency, or person engaged in a political activity.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-401 Title.
---------------------------------------
This part is known as "Disciplinary Actions and Appeals."

Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-402 Disciplinary charges -- Grounds -- Process.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-402(1): An appointing authority may demote, suspend, discharge, or reduce a merit system officer's pay for:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-402(1)(a): neglect of duty;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-402(1)(b): disobedience of a reasonable order;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-402(1)(c): misconduct;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-402(1)(d): inefficiency or inability to satisfactorily perform assigned duties; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-402(1)(e): an act inimical to public service.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-402(2): A department may not suspend a merit system officer for more than 176 work hours at one time or for more than 352 work hours in one year.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-402(3): The appointing authority shall order the demotion, reduction in pay, suspension, or discharge of a merit system officer.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-403 Disciplinary charges -- Appeal to commission -- Hearing -- Findings.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-403(1): The appointing authority:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-403(1)(a): may impose disciplinary charges in accordance with a rule, policy, ordinance, or law; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-403(1)(b): shall serve the merit system officer to be disciplined with a copy of the written charges.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-403(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-403(2)(a): A disciplined merit system officer may file an appeal of the disciplinary charges with the department, which shall conduct the appeal internally.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-403(2)(b): The department shall conduct an appeal in accordance with rules or policies adopted by the appointing authority.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-403(3): If the disciplinary charges are sustained on internal appeal, the merit system officer may appeal to the commission in accordance with the provisions of this section and commission rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-403(4): (1); (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-403(4)(a): (1); (2) A merit system officer disciplined in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-403(4)(b): If the merit system officer fails to make an internal appeal of the disciplinary action, the officer may not appeal to the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-403(5): 17-30a-402 The commission may hear appeals regarding demotion, reduction in pay, suspension, or discharge of a merit system officer for any cause provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-403(6): (6); (6)
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-403(6)(a): The commission shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-403(6)(a)(i): fix a time and place for a hearing on the appeal; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-403(6)(a)(ii): give notice of the hearing to the parties.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-403(6)(b): (6); (6)
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-403(6)(b)(i): (6); (6) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-403(6)(b)(ii): The commission may hold a hearing more than 90 days after an appeal is filed if:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-403(6)(b)(ii)(A): the parties agree; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-403(6)(b)(ii)(B): the commission finds that the delay is for good cause.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-403(7): Title 52, Chapter 4, Open and Public Meetings Act; (7); Title 52, Chapter 4, Open and Public Meetings Act
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-403(7)(a): Title 52, Chapter 4, Open and Public Meetings Act The commission shall hold the hearing in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-403(7)(b): (7); Title 52, Chapter 4, Open and Public Meetings Act Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-403(8): The parties may be represented by counsel at the hearing.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-403(9): The commission, on its own motion or at the request of the appointing authority, may dismiss an appeal for unjustified delay, removal to a court or other venue, or for other good cause shown.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-403(10): In resolving an appeal, the commission may sustain, modify, or vacate a decision of the appointing authority.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-403(11): After the hearing, the commission shall publish a written decision, including findings of fact and conclusions of law, and shall notify each party.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-404 Appeal to Court of Appeals -- Scope of review.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-404(1): A person may appeal a final action or order of the commission to the Court of Appeals for review.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-404(2): A person shall file a notice of appeal within 30 days of the issuance of the final action or order of the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-404(3): The Court of Appeals shall base its review on the record of the commission and for the purpose of determining if the commission has abused its discretion or exceeded its authority.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-501 Title.
---------------------------------------
This part is known as "Miscellaneous Provisions."

Utah Code Annotated § 17-30a-502 More than one chief deputy in larger county departments.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The sheriff, with the consent of the commission and the county legislative body, may appoint more than one chief deputy, deputy chief, or undersheriff.
