Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-228(1)(d): licensing;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-228(1)(e): health and safety;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-228(1)(f): county employment; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-228(1)(g): sanitation.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-228(2): (1) An ordinance adopted in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-228(3): (1) An administrative hearing held in accordance with an ordinance described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-228(4): A county may not impose a civil penalty and adjudication for the violation of a county moving traffic ordinance.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-228(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-228(5)(a): A county may not impose a nonjudicial penalty for a violation of a land use regulation or a nuisance ordinance unless the county provides to the individual who is subject to the penalty written notice that:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-228(5)(a)(i): identifies the relevant regulation or ordinance at issue;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-228(5)(a)(ii): specifies the violation of the relevant regulation or ordinance; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-228(5)(a)(iii): provides for a reasonable time to cure the violation, taking into account the cost of curing the violation.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-228(5)(b): A county may not collect on a nonjudicial penalty for a violation of a land use regulation or a nuisance ordinance that is outstanding or pending on or after May 14, 2019, unless the county imposed the outstanding or pending penalty in relation to a written notice that:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-228(5)(b)(i): identified the relevant regulation or ordinance at issue;

Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-228(5)(b)(iii): provided for a reasonable time to cure the violation, taking into account the cost of curing the violation.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-301 General powers, duties, and functions of county executive.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-301(1): The elected county executive is the chief executive officer of the county.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-301(2): Chapter 16, County Officers; Chapter 17, County Assessor; Chapter 18a, Powers and Duties of County and District Attorney; Chapter 19a, County Auditor; Chapter 20, County Clerk; Chapter 21, Recorder; Chapter 22, Sheriff; Chapter 23, County Surveyor; Chapter 24, County Treasurer Each county executive shall exercise all executive powers, have all executive duties, and perform all executive functions of the county, including those enumerated in this part, except as expressly provided otherwise in statute and except as contrary to the powers,  duties, and functions of other county officers expressly provided for in:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-301(2)(a): Chapter 16, County Officers
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-301(2)(b): Chapter 17, County Assessor
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-301(2)(c): Chapter 18a, Powers and Duties of County and District Attorney
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-301(2)(d): Chapter 19a, County Auditor
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-301(2)(e): Chapter 20, County Clerk
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-301(2)(f): Chapter 21, Recorder
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-301(2)(g): Chapter 22, Sheriff
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-301(2)(h): Chapter 23, County Surveyor
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-301(2)(i): Chapter 24, County Treasurer
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-301(3): A county executive may take any action required by law and necessary to the full discharge of the executive's duties, even though the action is not expressly authorized in statute.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-302 County executive duties.
--------------------------------------------------------
Each county executive shall:Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-302(1): exercise supervisory control over all functions of the executive branch of county government;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-302(2): direct and organize the management of the county in a manner consistent with state law, county ordinance, and the county's optional plan of county government;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-302(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-302(3)(a): carry out programs and policies established by the county legislative body; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-302(3)(b): ensure that all departments of county government comply with programs and policies established by the county legislative body;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-302(4): faithfully ensure compliance with all applicable laws and county ordinances;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-302(5): exercise supervisory and coordinating control over all departments of county government;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-302(6): 17-53-317 except as otherwise vested in the county legislative body by state law or by the optional plan of county government, and subject to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-302(7): except as otherwise delegated by statute to another county officer, exercise administrative and auditing control over all funds and assets, tangible and intangible, of the county;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-302(8): except as otherwise delegated by statute to another county officer, supervise and direct centralized budgeting, accounting, personnel management, purchasing, and other service functions of the county;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-302(9): conduct planning studies and make recommendations to the county legislative body relating to financial, administrative, procedural, and operational plans, programs, and improvements in county government;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-302(10): maintain a continuing review of expenditures and of the effectiveness of departmental budgetary controls;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-302(11): develop systems and procedures, not inconsistent with statute, for planning, programming, budgeting, and accounting for all activities of the county;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-302(12): if the county executive is an elected county executive, exercise a power of veto over the legislative enactments by the county legislative body, which are defined as county ordinances and budget appropriations, and include an item veto upon budget appropriations, in the manner provided by the optional plan of county government;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-302(13): review, negotiate, approve, and execute contracts for the county, unless otherwise provided by statute;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-302(14): perform all other functions and duties required of the executive by state law, county ordinance, and the optional plan of county government; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-302(15): sign on behalf of the county all deeds that convey county property.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-304 Commanding services of sheriff.
---------------------------------------------------------------
The county executive may direct the county sheriff to serve notices, subpoenas, citations, or other process issued by the executive, and to attend in person or by deputy all meetings conducted by the executive to preserve order.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-305 Warrants -- Authority to draw on treasurer.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
The county executive may settle and allow all accounts legally chargeable against the county, after their examination by the county auditor, and order warrants to be drawn on the county treasurer for those accounts.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-306 Warrants -- Required information -- Payment -- Registration.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-306(1): Each warrant drawn by order of the county executive on the county treasurer for current expenses during each year shall specify the liability for which it is drawn, when it accrued, and the funds from which it is to be paid.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-306(2): Each warrant shall be paid in the order of presentation to the treasurer.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-306(3): If the money in the treasury is insufficient to pay a warrant, the treasurer shall register the warrant and pay it in the order of registration.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-306(4): Accounts for county charges of every description shall be presented to the auditor and county executive to be audited as prescribed in statute.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-309 Approval of cost-increase changes in plans and specifications -- Delegation.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-309(1): If the county executive adopts plans and specifications for the alteration, construction, or repair of any public building or other public structure, the plans and specifications may not be altered or changed in any manner that would increase the cost of altering, constructing, or repairing the building or structure, unless the county executive approves the alteration or change in the plans and specifications.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-309(2): The county executive may adopt policies and procedures to delegate authority to approve alterations or changes in plans and specifications to a county employee, including the county engineer, architect, surveyor, or director of the department or division responsible for the work.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-310 Changes or alterations in contract -- Liability of county.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-310(1): If the county executive enters into a contract for the construction, alteration, or repair of any public building or other public structure, the contract may be altered or changed only if the alteration or change is within the general scope of the contract.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-310(2): If a change or alteration in the contract is made:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-310(2)(a): the particular change or alteration shall be specified in writing; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-310(2)(b): the increase or decrease in cost due to the change or alteration shall be established by the county executive according to either the provisions of the contract or established principles of the construction industry.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-310(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-310(3)(a): The county executive may adopt policies and procedures to delegate authority for approval of changes or alterations in the contract to a county employee, including the county engineer, architect, surveyor, or director of the department or division responsible for the work.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-310(3)(b): Unless the requirements of this section are met, the county is not liable for any extra work done on the buildings or public structures.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-312 County resource development committee -- Membership -- Term -- Compensation and expenses -- Duties.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-312(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-312(1)(a): A county executive may, with the advice and consent of the county legislative body, appoint a county resource development committee of three or more members, at least one of which shall be a member of the county legislative body.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-312(1)(b): Each member of a county resource development committee shall be a resident of the county.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-312(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-312(2)(a): The term of each member of a county resource development committee shall be two years and until a successor has been appointed.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-312(2)(b): The legislative body of each county with a county resource development committee shall provide by ordinance for the filling of a vacancy in the membership of the committee and for the removal of a member for nonperformance of duty or misconduct.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-312(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-312(3)(a): Each member shall serve without compensation.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-312(3)(b): The county legislative body may reimburse a member for actual expenses incurred in performing the member's duties and responsibilities on the committee, upon presentation of proper receipts and vouchers.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-312(4): The committee may elect such officers from its members as it considers appropriate and may, with the consent and approval of the county legislative body, employ an executive director for the committee.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-312(5): The committee shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-312(5)(a): assist in promoting the development of the county's mineral, water, manpower, industrial, historical, cultural, and other resources; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-312(5)(b): make such recommendations to the county for resource development as the committee considers advisable.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-312(6): The county executive may cooperate and enter into contracts with municipalities, local communities, other counties, and the state for the purpose of promoting the development of the economic, historical, and cultural resources of the county.

Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-314 Restrictions on county procurement of architect-engineer services.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-314(1): 58-3a-102; 58-22-102 As used in this section, "architect-engineer services" means those professional services within the scope of the practice of architecture as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-314(2): When a county elects to obtain architect or engineering services by using a competitive procurement process and has provided public notice of its competitive procurement process:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-314(2)(a): a higher education entity, or any part of one, may not submit a proposal in response to the county's competitive procurement process; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-314(2)(b): the county may not award a contract to perform the architect or engineering services solicited in the competitive procurement process to a higher education entity or any part of one.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-315 Actions -- Control and direction.
-----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-315(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-315(1)(a): A county executive may control and direct the prosecution, defense, and settlement of all lawsuits and other actions:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-315(1)(a)(i): to which the county is a party;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-315(1)(a)(ii): as to which the county may be required to pay the judgment or the costs of prosecution or defense; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-315(1)(a)(iii): as further provided by county ordinance.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-315(1)(b): If necessary, the county executive may, upon the recommendation of the county or district attorney or if required by court order, employ counsel to represent the county in the lawsuit or other action or assist the county attorney or, in a county that does not have a county attorney, the district attorney in conducting those lawsuits or any other actions where the county attorney or district attorney, as the case may be, is authorized by law to act.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-315(2): If a lawsuit or other action is brought or prosecuted by another elected official or a board or other entity of the county under a statutory duty, that other elected official, board, or other entity may control and direct the lawsuit or other action, consistent with applicable law.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-316 Executive orders.
-------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-316(1): The county executive may issue an executive order to:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-316(1)(a): establish an executive policy;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-316(1)(b): implement an executive practice; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-316(1)(c): execute a legislative policy or ordinance, as provided by statute.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-316(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-316(2)(a): The county executive may not issue an executive order that:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-316(2)(a)(i): is inconsistent with county ordinances that address the same subject as the executive order or with policies established by the county legislative body that address the same subject as the executive order; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-316(2)(a)(ii): expands or narrows legislative action taken or legislative policy issued by the county legislative body.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-316(2)(b): If a county legislative body adopts an ordinance or establishes a policy that conflicts with an existing executive order, the ordinance or policy adopted or established by the county legislative body supersedes the executive order.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-316(3): 17-53-106 Each executive order exercising supervisory power over other elected county officers shall be consistent with the authority given the county executive under Section

Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-318 Governing body as cooperating agency in federal land planning and regulation.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-318(1): Title 17, Chapter 27a, Part 4, General Plan As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-318(1)(a): "Cooperating agency" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-318(1)(a)(i): a cooperating agency as defined in 43 CFR 1601.0-5; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-318(1)(a)(ii): a cooperating agency as defined in 40 CFR 1508.5.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-318(1)(b): Title 17, Chapter 27a, Part 4, General Plan "General plan" means the general plan described in
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-318(1)(c): "Governing body" means, respectively:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-318(1)(c)(i): a county commission;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-318(1)(c)(ii): a county council and county executive; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-318(1)(c)(iii): a county council and county manager.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-318(2): A governing body or a person designated by the governing body:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-318(2)(a): may represent the county as a cooperating agency; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-318(2)(b): is considered to have special expertise:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-318(2)(b)(i): in a matter related to the:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-318(2)(b)(i)(A): National Environmental Policy Act of 1969, 42 U.S.C. Sec. 4321 et seq.;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-318(2)(b)(i)(B): Federal Land Policy Management Act of 1976, 43 U.S.C. Sec. 1701 et seq.;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-318(2)(b)(i)(C): Wilderness Act of 1964, 16 U.S.C. Sec. 1131 et seq.;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-318(2)(b)(i)(D): Multiple-Use Sustained Yield Act of 1960, 16 U.S.C. Sec. 528 et seq.;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-318(2)(b)(i)(E): National Forest Management Act of 1976, 16 U.S.C. Sec. 1600 et seq.; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-318(2)(b)(i)(F): an energy policy and conservation act amended by the Energy Policy Act of 2005, 42 U.S.C. Sec. 16511 et seq.;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-318(2)(b)(ii): in a matter related to federal land development and planning, the implementation of a federal resource management plan, and other related federal land management actions;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-318(2)(b)(iii): regarding whether a federal land development and plan, resource management plan, or other related federal land management action is consistent with an adopted county general plan; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-318(2)(b)(iv): on a subject matter for which it has statutory responsibility, including a subject matter related to the health, safety, welfare, custom, culture, or socioeconomic viability of a county.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-318(3): A county through its governing body or a person designated by the governing body may participate in efforts to coordinate and make consistent the federal agency resource management plan or other related management action with the general plan as provided in:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-318(3)(a): the Federal Land Policy Management Act of 1976, 43 U.S.C. Sec. 1701 et seq.;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-318(3)(b): 16 U.S.C. Sec. 1604; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-53-318(3)(c): any other federal law or rule that provides for coordination and consistency with local government plans and policies.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 17 - Chapter 55 - Criminal Justice Coordinating Councils
************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-101 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-101(1): 63M-7-201 "Commission" means the State Commission on Criminal and Juvenile Justice created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-101(2): "Criminal justice agency" means an agency or institution directly involved in the apprehension, prosecution, or incarceration of a person involved in criminal activity.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-101(3): 17-55-201 "Criminal justice coordinating council" or "council" means a council created by a county or counties in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-101(4): "Criminal justice system" means the continuum of criminal justice agencies and post-incarceration services that an individual may encounter as a result of the individual's criminal activity.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-101(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-101(5)(a): "Post-incarceration services" means services that may assist an individual who is leaving incarceration to reintegrate into the community.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-101(5)(b): "Post-incarceration services" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-101(5)(b)(i): educational services;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-101(5)(b)(ii): housing services;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-101(5)(b)(iii): health care services;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-101(5)(b)(iv): workforce services; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-101(5)(b)(v): human services programs.


Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-201 Criminal justice coordinating councils -- Creation -- Strategic plan -- Reporting requirements.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-201(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-201(1)(a): Beginning January 1, 2023, a county shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-201(1)(a)(i): create a criminal justice coordinating council; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-201(1)(a)(ii): jointly with another county or counties, create a criminal justice coordinating council.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-201(1)(b): The purpose of a council is to coordinate and improve components of the criminal justice system in the county or counties.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-201(2): 77-38-403
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-201(2)(a): 77-38-403 A council shall include:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-201(2)(a)(i): one county commissioner or county council member;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-201(2)(a)(ii): the county sheriff or the sheriff's designee;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-201(2)(a)(iii): one chief of police of a municipality within the county or the chief's designee;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-201(2)(a)(iv): the county attorney or the attorney's designee;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-201(2)(a)(v): one public defender or attorney who provides public defense within the county;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-201(2)(a)(vi): one district court judge;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-201(2)(a)(vii): one justice court judge;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-201(2)(a)(viii): one representative from the Division of Adult Probation and Parole within the Department of Corrections;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-201(2)(a)(ix): one representative from the local mental health authority within the county; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-201(2)(a)(x): 77-38-403 one individual who is:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-201(2)(a)(x)(A): a crime victim; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-201(2)(a)(x)(B): 77-38-403 a victim advocate, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-201(2)(b): A council may include:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-201(2)(b)(i): an individual representing:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-201(2)(b)(i)(A): local government;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-201(2)(b)(i)(B): human services programs;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-201(2)(b)(i)(C): higher education;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-201(2)(b)(i)(D): peer support services;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-201(2)(b)(i)(E): workforce services;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-201(2)(b)(i)(F): local housing services;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-201(2)(b)(i)(G): mental health or substance use disorder providers;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-201(2)(b)(i)(H): a health care organization within the county;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-201(2)(b)(i)(I): a local homeless council;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-201(2)(b)(i)(J): family counseling and support groups; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-201(2)(b)(i)(K): organizations that work with families of incarcerated individuals; or
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-201(2)(b)(ii): an individual with lived experiences in the criminal justice system.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-201(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-201(3)(a): A member who is an elected county official shall serve as chair of the council.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-201(3)(b): The council shall elect the member to serve as chair under Subsection (3)(a).
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-201(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-201(4)(a): A council shall develop and implement a strategic plan for the county's or counties' criminal justice system that includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-201(4)(a)(i): mapping of all systems, resources, assets, and services within the county's or counties' criminal justice system;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-201(4)(a)(ii): a plan for data sharing across the county's or counties' criminal justice system;
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-201(4)(a)(iii): recidivism reduction objectives; and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-201(4)(a)(iv): community reintegration goals.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-201(4)(b): The commission may assist a council in the development of a strategic plan.
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-201(5): 77-18-105 As part of the council's duties described in Subsection (4)(a)(i), the council shall prepare a list of private probation providers for a court to provide to defendants as described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-201(6): Before November 30 of each year, a council shall provide a written report to the commission regarding:
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-201(6)(a): the implementation of a strategic plan described in Subsection (4); and
Utah Code Annotated § 17-55-201(6)(b): any data on the impact of the council on the criminal justice system in the county or counties.
